Reviews.Title: “Great location & customer service”
Reviews.Author: palo r
Reviews.Content: Great location! Not far from UCLA, Rodeo Dr. Minutes away from the mall, even complimentary hotel car! Valet was awesome! Wonderful customer service from the gentleman who opened my door down to the cute cashier with a fun name! Parking is a little pricey, but that's expected. Check-in was quick. Staff was welcoming. Had an issue with our shower so we got an room upgrade and complimentary drinks at the bar! Room service menu is limited. Overall, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW with a touch of WOW”
Reviews.Author: jasonsbradshaw
Reviews.Content: A huge room, amazing service, quality room service and very helpful housekeeping staff. great car service and a location that is close enough to be handy but also not in the thick of things. Great recreational facilities.

Reviews.Title: “room smelt v bad some other concerns but everything that ultimately matters in a hotel stay was great.”
Reviews.Author: Happyegg29
Reviews.Content: firstly dislikes:- really disapponting perks from being an ambassador member with the intercontinental group. Had much better perks with other chains within the group ie. holiday inn and crowne plaza etc. I thought being an actual intercontinental hotel the benefits would be rewarded more there from loyalty. So no free breakfast- a big surprise.But a free film choice was given. you HAD to use valet parking. Although they were friendly most people are there as tourists and want the freedom and flexibility to get in their car when they want and go out and about in la. this wasnt possible with valet you have to go down with ticket get them to go and fetvh the car wait while that happens really frustrating. Also you had to pay $36ish for this. When we didnt even want to use it. As a another couple of reviewers have written, I also have to comment the room stunk, it was very bad other reviewers have described as wet dog it was a old musty vile smell in the lounge area of the suite. Having said this I will be fair - the bedroom was fine and so we didnt ask to move rooms. The furniture looks like it has had better days, the settee needed to go in the tip it was a faded ornage brown colour which was once clearly a dark brown settee. carpet was old too. however as i say in the title the things that genuinely matter on a stay in a hotel were good.. bed- was extremely comfortable and luxurious clean new sheets as you appreciate a good nights sleep when travelling. Products were high quality and good brand although tiny bottles and 1 bottle per 2 so not enough. They were happy to provide more when i requested. breakfast was wonderful- really impressed with it. Although pricey it was the best I had had all through my trip and i had just come from staying at the encore wynn - las vegas amongst many other 5* high end hotels. It was delicious and really enjoyed. the guest service was also very good and i was impressed that i was called after i requested more toiletteries to make sure someone had brought them. Overall it was fine to stay the night with a good nights sleep and lovely breakfast for either a business traveller or on holiday. The room did smell very bad in the lounge which is off putting and valet forced upon you was really annoying. they could do with just having a small carpark for guests wanting to use that I would not want to stay for more than 1 night though. I would not stay again purely as I was not happy with the lack of reward/benefits for being a top member of their loyalty programme. Was really disappointed with this. So would choose a different hotel perhaps within the group where we felt more valued for our loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “No Big Complaints, just lacked flair”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Century City area of Los Angeles, which is a good central location between Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. Although this hotel is just a bit out of the main area it feels a little isolated. It is surrounded by office buildings and apartments and really not an area a tourist would want to be in, as it's far from the main shopping area of Century City. The hotel looks like an Eastern Europe, Soviet built block. It has no charm or style from the outside. It almost has a bunker like feel to it. The lobby is spacious and had some color with a large table of beautiful flowers, but overall the lobby and public areas feel a bit cold. The service was efficient, but not overly friendly. It was by no means rude, just very business like and did feel welcoming in anyway. The parking fee is $36.30 per day, which I found outrageous. We stayed for 3 days and our parking cost was $100.00. The hotel is so out of main stream of Century City it was kind of an insult to pay such a big parking fee. I found the halls of the hotel very odd. It was like a maze to get to our room. We had so many twists and turns it was easy to get lost inside the hotel. Our room was fine. It was a little dated. It did not have much flair. It was brown and beige and not interesting. We did have a nice view of Westwood from our balcony. We did eat in the hotel restaurant one night and the menu is very limited and has an odd selection of food items. Overall I would stay here again if the price was right. My complaints are small. However, this would never be a first choice for an LA area hotel - it just lacked personality.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: FairGrader
Reviews.Content: I expected a lot more from an Intercontinental. While the lobby looks nice and the ballrooms were very recently renovated, the rooms are quite dated and disappointing. The layout of our room was strange - you couldn't leave the bathroom door open because if you opened the door to the room it would bang the bathroom door! Apparently this happened to a lot of people because there was a groove worn in the bathroom door where the lock on the front door had hit it repeatedly. The bathroom was poorly lit with a small shower - just felt "icky." The hotel restaurant is not worth the money - expensive, food is poor quality, although service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but I'd try elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: Clarkthehorse
Reviews.Content: Prior to my stay at the Intercontinental, I had just come from a hotel in another city that had 1st class service and a spotless facility. The Intercontinental didn't fare so well on comparison. Service was okay, but fairly impersonal and brusque. When I was at the front desk for check-in and check-out, the staff who helped me took multiple phone calls while I stood there waiting, without any apology. No one asked how my stay was. In terms of the room, it was very spacious but in need of updating. There were multiple places where the wall paper was dirty -- splattered with something -- and the bathroom felt old and short on amenities. My room service breakfast was not particularly good and hugely overpriced. All in all, I'd look elsewhere next time I went to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jannaweber
Reviews.Content: I visited the InterContinental for 2 days for a business trip. The room and bed we wonderful, particularly after a 7 hour flight from the East Coast. The cab ride from the airport was about $30 depending on traffic. The Wireless internet is not free. The lobby and court yard is nice but I didn't have time during my trip to find the pool. Service was fast and friendly. Would definitely consider going back to this hotel if I need to be in the same area of LA. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Hotel Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Generally a top class hotel with excellent staff and service. On hour stay I would single out the concierge staff and restaurant staff for special mention for their friendly and helpful service. The hotel website describes the location as "minutes away" from various areas of interest - for example Rodeo Drive. In reality all the areas of interest, Rodeo Drive, Hollywood Boulevard ,Kodak Theatre etc are between 10 and 30 minutes away by car !

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service & room not so bad either”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here March 12-14, 2012. From the time you pull into the property you treated like no other. The valet staff is gracious, the person opening the front door is wonderful, the front desk staff was friendly, & the bed was comfortable. My only complaint was the room had several scuff marks all over the wall, but that is my only complaint. They had a separate shower/tub, which was outstanding! The bed was comfortable & we even had our own balcony. The location of the property is excellent! The hotel is right in front of the Fox Studios, a 2 minute drive to Beverly Hills, & a short 20 minute drive to Santa Monica. I would not hesitate to book another room here again. Please keep up the excellent customer service and thank you for having Evian water in your hotel! Happy Traveling :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, watch out for the extras”
Reviews.Author: fi_earthling
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel to stay for business. Located centrally on Avenue of the Stars, easy to access from the airport, and easy to get anywhere in the Century City/ Beverly Hills area, esp using the complimentary house car service provided at the concierge desk. Staff are helpful and courteous Rooms are large but rather dated. Bathroom clean but could do with a refurb, and shower pressure really inadequate. Nice Elemis toiletries. One major niggle - Food and extras (minibar, internet) really are extortionate, verging on the ridiculous. In particular, water in the room is $10 a bottle!!!!! In a hotel of this standard, water should ALWAYS be complimentary. Escape the mediocre overpriced food here and walk to Century City mall, where there is a large food court for good value lunches, and a selection of decent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GandJ2011
Reviews.Content: We had a balcony and a view to die for! Overlooked LA and faced the "HOLLYWOOD" sign! The suite was VERY nice and comfortable! The parking was $36 a night for valet parking but they were wonderful and very accomodating when we needed our vehicle it was delivered within minutes! The one ding was having to pay for internet. Still trying to figure out why a larger/more spendy upscale hotel can't offer free internet as a convenience to their guests???

Reviews.Title: “Premium location”
Reviews.Author: YardleyYoung
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nicely decor with matching colour of sets of bouquet. It has a free shuttle to century city mall. I like the quality and the range of the amenities. If you come as a tourist and will get a hop on hop off city tour, this hotel is also the right hotel as the tour will have a stopping point right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great place to stay, and after the refurb....”
Reviews.Author: heeler1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed Here for 8 nights and because of that and our frequent travel feel cpable of a balanced review. This hotel does a great job on all fronts and should be on your list if visiting the LA area. From the lovely welcome on arrival, complete with easy early checkin, to daily warm regards from valet staff we really did feel part of the family. Pool area is clean, well supplied and well kept, there is good table service with a good menu. The gym is simply fantstic with a variety of amenities for the regular gym rat, we did not run into the crowded problem of other travellers and we were here for a week during spring break. Meal service was slowish but asking for the bill early really helps. The lobby bar is relaxed and reasonably priced. We found sitting outside at the fire pit lounge chairs particularly nice. The rooms are good but SLIGHTLY dated. If you think this is a dated hotel room, you don't travel much. Even so, there is a refurb starting this year and then, watch out. This will become a very high end place to stay. As it is, it is fine, although we agree that the air conditioning is difficult and not terribly efficient. Still, every facet of our stay was enjoyable and worth the price. Convenience is huge. we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional and reliable”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: This hotel, when newer and under prior management, was a true luxury hotel and always a pleasant experience. Under Intercontinental's management, it's reached the point of needing a limited renovation: scraped finish on doors and furniture is noticeable in spots, and the '90s-era, Four Seasons-type decor is at least a decade out of date (purple lights on a curtain behind the check-in desk and in other spots add only an odd cosmetic effect). But reasonable prices (a night for $250), sizable and quiet rooms, great views and a superb breakfast are sufficient compensation. It's probably the most reliable, calmest and conveniently located hotel on the West Side (ten minutes from Beverly Hills, Westwood or the Santa Monica Freeway).

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: jetsettter
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel. Being an Ambassador (Platinum) I stay here because of this loyalty programme and because under that loyalty programme the benefits outweigh staying anywhere else. I like the solitude of the location and yet it is handy to anywhere and on the hop-on-hop-off bus route if you want to sightsee. A 5-10 minute walk to Century City shops and cinemas, 25 min taxi ride to Hollywood/Bevely Hills (traffic permitting). I like being able to check-in at 8.30am and be told my room is ready and upgraded. I also like being offerred the choice to take my own bags to the room or have someone take them for me. I especially like the welcome and the efficient check-in. Hotel room was okay, not much light in the bathroom and an incredibly noisy air con unit but the bed and pillows were comfortable, the ability to work in the room was okay and the daily service was fine. I had room service breakfast twice and on both occassions felt it was adequate rather than great - unfortunately at almost $30 there is no value. This is a reliable hotel that will meet most expectations, staff are friendly and attentive. For me it was an unremarkable stay - and thats exactly how i wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, but the restaurant service is very slow”
Reviews.Author: gratefulfortravel
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We always stay in a suite whenever we visit and the staff is amazing. They know us and remember us from visit to visit. They are very child friendly and the rooms are incredibly delightful. The beds are very comfortable. I'm not a huge fan of LA in general, but this hotel makes coming back enticing. The only part of the hotel that could use some assistance is the restaurant service in the main dining room. The breakfasts take at least 45 minutes after you order- which is somewhat ridiculous. They do however offer a full Japanese breakfast, which we love, and is perhaps worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Tarina C
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel as its rather close to a mall and movie theatre. The interior design is well thought out and it was extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars Are You Nuts?”
Reviews.Author: LaughLat
Reviews.Content: Great physical facility, location and rooms. This hotel is not what it used to be, as the former JW Marriott and Park Hyatt. Under the “reign” as opposed to “stewardship” of InterContinental, it is a shadow of what it once was. Five stars are you crazy? A five star hotel has a clear sense of identity. This one is suffering from a severe identity crisis. They have run off most of the American clientele, except for conventioneers. There are many guests now from overseas that are vacationing mixed in with business travellers, conventioneers and during my stay, shockingly, gaudy gold buying companies that you would expect at a Radisson or Holiday Inn. So you get everything from tourists enjoying sight seeing in Los Angeles, to the few (relative to days of old) American business travellers to gaudy gold buyers allowed to hang their oversize and hideous signs just outside the “Spa.” I want to be clear that I enjoyed meeting the variety of guests there and even giving them pointers on where to “star gaze.” That was not the issue per se. The problem is that a hotel with five star status is either a top notch full service resort (which this hotel is not) or it is a reliable consistent higher end business destination (again, not so. They don’t even have a business center and send business clients to Kinko’s—seriously?). The best five star hotels can actually meet the needs of both vacationing and business clientele seamlessly. The food also is suffering an identity crisis, consisting of ridiculously expensive, tiny and fussily arranged dishes, steaks that are tiny and leathery (I’ve had much better at Marriott’s under-rated mid-level hotels). And the Spa, built by the former Park Hyatt has treatment rooms that are unparalleled anywhere else I have been in the States. In addition, their staff for the most part, and treatment therapists are also excellent. However, the hotel, trying to discover another identity, has opened the spa doors to local clientele (I suspect trying to compete with the toney but overdone Equinox down the street). This has clogged the “Fitness Center” day and night and made the Spa largely unavailable to hotel guests, especially the business clientele that are in meetings all day and have limited openings in their schedules. I’ve never been to a Spa where I began to feel they’d rather I just go home than walk in seeking another treatment. Though they claim hotel guests have priority, this is very, very far from the case. The only consistent identity this hotel has is one of getting every penny in every way conceivable and some inconceivable--and keeping rooms full, full, full no matter what the cost to their guests and hard working employees (the hotel is also pretty soundly understaffed). Twice they sent up a room service disaster. Apologies were in short supply and God forbid they would consider “comping” anyone for anything. I had to go round and round. The first time the best I could do was ask for the order to be remade, nearly two hours after I had initially ordered my meal. The second time a front desk manager with a title but no apparent discretionary judgment, told me to talk to the room service manager. I objected to having an alleged manager send a guest to talk to another manager. The front desk manager finally caved and “comped” part of the meal. This is cheesy stuff, not even the stuff of four stars. The best thing about the hotel by far is the staff. With just a few exceptions, I’m not talking about the bean counters at the front desk or the Director of Ops/GM whose sole purpose in life is to get that fifth star--guests and his extraordinary staff be damned. I find the reviews of this hotel highly suspicious and out of touch--more lop-sided and odd than any other set of reviews I’ve read on this site. The reviewer was right about the bills here. I actually sent my last two to be reviewed by my CPA. They seriously abused my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars? Are you crazy?”
Reviews.Author: LahFlawOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a far cry from what it once was as the Park Hyatt and former JW Marriott. The facilities themselves are exceptional, though in need of better maintenance. The location is excellent and most room layouts extraordinary. However under the "reign" (as opposed to "stewardship") of InterContinental all I can say is... Five stars are you crazy? A five star hotel has a clear sense of identity. This one is suffering from a severe identity crisis. They have run off most of the American clientele, except for conventioneers. There are many guests now from overseas that are vacationing mixed in with business travellers, conventioneers and during my stay, shockingly, gaudy gold buying companies that you would expect at a Radisson or Holiday Inn. So you get everything from tourists shopping and enjoying sight seeing in Los Angeles, to the few (relative to days of old) American business travellers to gaudy gold buyers allowed to hang their oversized and hideous signs just outside the “Spa.” I want to be clear that I enjoyed meeting the increasing variety of guests there and even giving them pointers on where to “star gaze.” That was not the issue per se. The problem is that a hotel with five star status is either a top notch full service resort (which this hotel is not) or it is a reliable consistent higher end business destination (again, not so--they do not even have a business center, but send guests to Kinko's--seriously?). The best five star hotels can pull off BOTH seamlessly, attending to all the needs of various clientele. The food also is suffering an identity crisis, now consisting of ridiculously expensive, tiny and fussily arranged dishes, steaks that are like now also tiny and leathery (I’ve had much better at Marriott’s under-rated mid-level hotels). And the Spa, built by the former Park Hyatt has treatment rooms that are unparalleled anywhere else I have been in the States. In addition, their staff for the most part, and treatment therapists are also excellent. However, the hotel, trying to discover another identity (read "identity" as generate even more revenue), has opened the Spa doors to local clientele (I suspect trying to compete with the tony but overdone Equinox down the street). This has clogged the “Fitness Center” day and night and made the Spa largely unavailable to hotel guests, especially the business clientele that are in meetings all day and have limited openings in their schedules. I’ve never been to a Spa where I began to feel they’d rather I just go home than walk in seeking another treatment. Though they claim hotel guests have priority, it became clear very quickly that this was not the case. The only consistent identity this hotel has now, is one of getting every penny in every way conceivable and some inconceivable--and keeping rooms full, full, full no matter what the cost to their guests and hard working employees (the hotel is also pretty soundly understaffed). One night they sent up a room service disaster. Apologies were in short supply and God forbid they would consider “comping” anyone for anything. I had to go round and round. And the best I could do was ask for the order to be remade, nearly two hours after I had initially ordered my meal. The best thing about the hotel that remains, however tenuously, is by far the staff. And I’m not talking about the bean counters at the front desk or the GM whose sole purpose in life is to get that fifth star, guests and his extraordinary staff be damned. (For what he has done to this once very special hotel, I’d like him to see stars all right.) I find the reviews of this hotel highly suspicious and out of sync with what is actually going on there. I agree with the reviewer about the bills. I actually handed my last one over to my CPA--I'm not kidding.

Reviews.Title: “How is this not 5 star?”
Reviews.Author: bocaberger
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the front door you are greeted by seemingly a team of greeters, one that grabs each door of your car and lets passengers out, while others head for your luggage. They make you feel like a celebrity, holding the doors for your and calling you Mr. ____. There was a bellman who was assigned to us and stayed with us through the very short check in process and up to the room. Explaining all the features of the hotel and giving you a run down of the neighborhood as well. I recognized that all of the bellman and entire entry team are connected with wires to their ears (like secret service agents) obviously organizing everything to make your check in and arrival every time you come downstairs or back after a night on the town seamless. The hotel is beautiful and the lobby area is extremely welcoming. Each night they even had live music in the lobby, and a sushi bar set up. My wife commented that it was by far the best sushi she has ever had. Our room itself was decent in size with 2 double beds. Our view was incredible with a direct veranda staring at the famous Hollywood sign on the mountain. The beds were very comfortable, but the pillows were not great. I regret not asking for new ones, because I am sure they would have sent them up. The bathroom amenities kit was superior with high end shampoos and lotions. 2 Robes hung in the closet, and there was a sticked mini bar (albeit very expensive). Keurig machine in room with complimentary coffee. The outdoor heated pool area is very nice, and there was a service phone on the pool deck, that if you lifted it up there was a team of culinary experts waiting to take your order and bring anything you desire (food and drink) to you poolside. We were only there for two nights so we didn't get to use the spa, but those guests who did were raving. Overall the staff is the absolute best I have ever experienced, and I truly can not understand how this is not a 5 star hotel. They treat everyone like a celebrity, and made our stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental century city is great”
Reviews.Author: bula2010
Reviews.Content: Aftr a long flight the reception staff greeted us with warm smiles, welcomed us and took us to a huge I/connecting suite. It was great,practical, spacious. Desk area was great for my husband to do his work and excellent wifi connection. Staff incredible, clearly customer servic is a priority and especially with those at concierge - so attentive -NOTHING was too much trouble, they even went to the pharmacy for us late one night. Food delicious and well priced! Town car driving you around omplimentary a huge bonus Great stay looking to return December 2012 Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for some time. Rooms - spacious, contemporary, clean Bathroom - separate tub and shower, stone tiles, stone and large counter Balcony Services - Hotel staff is fast and courteous It has all the amenities that a traveler could need or want.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: gonebutnotdeparted
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was rated as a 4 star,but it was in my opinion considerably better than that. They do nearly everything right from opening your door to giving rides in the property limo if it is not in use. It does not have a porte cochere at the entrance. I know this is LA but I found this strange. Only noticed because it was raining when I arrived. Of course they don't need one since the valet immediately came out with umbrella in hand ready to fend off any of the unusual bits of water falling from the sky. I see a few negative comments on the rooms. I must have been given a renovated room as the descriptions don't match what I found. I would never pay five fifty for the room but at one thirty on hotwire, it is a serious bargain. I was a bit uncomfortable mixing with the predominantly vainglorious clientele. I felt like I need to have a jacket just to go to the pool. I am sure I was uncomfortable simply being outclassed. Speaking of the pool. this is a very nice outdoor area with cabanas and a large pool suitable for short laps. You will find everything you need here in the well-appointed/maintained rooms including excellent robes. Because this hotel seemed to serve wealthy clientele you can expect everything to cost a fortune from the internet to the parking. the restaurant and bar menu is good and not too highly priced however the dishes seem to be all tapas; but you can't tell that form the descriptions. You only know that when the miniature portion arrives. Eventually I became so hungry after the third day working from the food deficit that I asked the restaurant waiter if they could serve a larger portion, which he happily did. The bar is hit or miss depending on the bartender on duty. If you see a young guy there, expect to wait a bit and explain simple terms like what "neat" means or put up with ice in your whiskey. The business center will do anything form you; again, it will cost you. Property is first class, but you so must you be or you will feel uncomfortable. They can and will do anything to help you, but it will cost you. Do not pay rack rate. You can Hotwire this hotel for one hundred thirty at times. If you don't use Hotwire you should check it out - they give you satisfaction ratings which make it better, (athough a bit higher priced), than priceline. Within (long) walking distance of the Westfield mall with good restaurants or ask for a ride in the hotel vehicle to nearby spots.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: CordeyLash
Reviews.Content: Exquisite arrival, staff and lobby appointments. Nice build up to some of the most disappointing guest rooms in the segment. Very clean but chic lobby did not prepare me for the 80's old lady decor, utter disappointment for this gem of a property... The owners are leaving serious ADR by not renovating accordingly :(

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: FMichaelR
Reviews.Content: The weird thing about these well-oiled corporate machine hotels is how badly oiled they are. Nothing is quite right. You've got the glitzy musaked-up foyer and then you've got mould in the shower. You've got room-service ignoring the 'Do not disturb' sign and knocking on your door then disappearing without apology when you answer. You've got front desk asking you what complementary newspaper you'd like in the morning and then it never ever being delivered no matter how many times you ask them. You've got paper-thin walls so you can hear every breath from the neighbouring room. You could spend the same money and stay somewhere that functions as a hotel. I'd recommend a neighborhood other than the dead zone that is Century City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Front Desk Staff Great”
Reviews.Author: Solar2010
Reviews.Content: I checked in today and was very surprised as to how nice this particular InterContiental was. I have stayed at several other locations primarily in Toronto but this is one of the nicer properties. Additionally, Ed at the front desk was great upon checking in. He was very knowledgeable about the area and also followed up with me after I was in my room to ensure that I was satisfied. Definitely would recommend this hotel and you will enjoy the location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: townsend416
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterCon for a wedding in the LA area. Overall, we found the service to be very good - particularly the concierge and room service. As other reviewers have mentioned, this is a very corporate hotel, but it was well-located for our needs. My biggest gripe was that the hotel was lacking in maid service. We stayed three nights and only once was our trash emptied; we felt like they sort of phoned it in. If I were to stay there again, I'd be a little more active about making sure they clean all they are supposed to. The gym is pretty nice, but the women's locker room could use an upgrade - I was unable to use the steam room or sauna b/c it didnt get warm enough and the attendant said both rooms were already on thier highest setting. I've heard very good things about the spa treatments, but skip the steam/sauna. The pool is also nice, but nothing interesting. It was a huge help to have the car service that drops you up to 1.5 miles from the hotel -- this gets you to the Westfield Mall - which has a very nice selection of shops. It was a nice answer to constantly taking your car our of valet -- which also can get pricey w/constant tipping. I would say the rooms are a bit dated, but perfectly nice. We stayed in 628, which has great light - nice balcony, but it overlooked the Fox lot - not terribly interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 10 nights and had a great time we arrived from a long flight and the check in process was so easy and the staff were very helpful the roon was great and clean and they also provide a house car to take you to and from the hotel on a first come first serve basis but I think we only had to wait once for it and that was only for 10 mins the breakfast was a bit over priced for what it was but the guys on the desk recommended a fantastic place called John o'groats which was just round the corner and we just used to jump in the house car every morning ang go simples. Also taxi cabs are always just outside and the hotel is on a tourist bus route , we had a great time and Would defo stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Nice property...although a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: Just checked in last night, and decided to stay another night. I have probably stayed at this hotel 30 times over the past 7 years or so. THis hotel was formerly a Park Hyatt, and has changed very little since the conversion to Intercontinental a few years ago. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. Beds are awesome. The decor is a bit dated though, being much the same as when then i first stayed here many years ago. There seems to be a clash of styles between the VERY traditional feel of the hotel rooms and suites....and the more contemporary decor updates (cheap) that were added to the lobby and exterior a couple years ago. Leaves me wondering what this hotel is trying to be??? LED wall washers behind the front desk change the color of the back wall like a "W" property of similar. Doesnt fit with the rest of the hotel. Other visual clashes make less sense. Intercontinental usually has a more seamless design...... Pool has a nice, large deck...although again could use a bit of updating. Seems a bit 80's, as does the gym. Again, everything is clean....works well... but it is dated. Restaurant was fine for breakfast....great. Thats the only thing i tried there, as there are SO many wonderful dining options outside. The location is great, almost residential. Just south of Century City on Avenue of the Stars...the Mall is a short walk on a nice day. Great proximity to Beverly Hills and all Highways. Quiet. I was not so impressed with the Concierge, as he seemed a bit rushed, and gruff. The hotel has a car that will take you anywhere in close proximity of the hotel, and i inquired yesterday morning to use the car to head to Beverly Hills. I called downstairs to ask the Concierge about using the car at 9:30 yesterday morning. I was told "Car Service begins at 10:00". OK....i proceeded to ask how i reserve the car: "Car Service starts at 10:00" and is 'first come first serve". Where do i meet, or inquire" "Car service starts at 10:00....in the lobby". OK, i got it. He was short, gruff....and i wanted to shout " I got (expletive omitted)...the car service starts at 10:00, I'm not stupid." I bit my tongue not to rip his head off verbally. I really was not impressed with the concierge then, or later when i when to get the car. Again, he probably had a tough morning.....we all do. In short, i like this hotel...but i dont LOVE it, and i usually LOVE intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying”
Reviews.Author: nitinkalra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Intercontinental Century City during my trip to LA in January 2012. It was a pleasant experience - since I booked the hotel by calling them up, the staff was cordial enough to provide me with the best room possible - booking for smooth and easy, check in was equally smooth - they knew of my arrival in advance and my room was neat and clean. I was on the 4th floor and my room gave me a great view of the city. The service at the hotel was quick, the food was good whereas I found the bar to be bit more expensive than normal standards - however the hotel's proximity to the Westfield Shopping Place (I hope I am remembering the correct name) is a blessing - you get everything there from food to drinks and even grocery and other shopping needs. I had a complimentary internet service at my room, which was a blessing for me.

Reviews.Title: “One of the WORST hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Christian M
Reviews.Content: was promised a room with 2 queen beds but ended up with 2 doubles. Arrived from a long flight at 12, the front desk said that our room will be ready for us at 1:30, at 3:00 it was still not finished. Key card hardly ever worked. Excellent maids except when they took away my contact lens case.. I was expecting free wifi since the room was expensive but sadly not.. the wifi didnt work anyway and when i called how to work the internet they sent me through to an internet support. i was talking to them for an hour and after that the internet still didnt work. The front desk service was poor.. there were holes in the net curtains, the phone by the desk didnt work..... I will never stay at the Intercontinental again because of the high price for bad rooms.

Reviews.Title: “tired”
Reviews.Author: sydney69England
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little dated I'm afraid. Rooms are a nice size, with a separate bath and shower which I always prefer. It has a gym and smallish pool area. The rooms had old style light switches,door handles etc so you could tell it was probably an 80's style property. My room had some wall paper coming off the wall (and I am a priority club member!!). Also, there were no slippers in the room, no bottled water or free newspaper which for a business hotel I found quite strange. Plus it has valet only car parking which costs $30 per day (plus tax and the dreaded" tip" of course!!)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: LT441
Reviews.Content: I checked in today and I'm already looking for another hotel to switch to. I've stayed here a few times and they do have a mix of rooms from great to zero stars. When I checked in they said they only had a few rooms left which means you're getting the worst - and I did. The room has very little furniture and the furniture that is in it is old and falling to bits. It's a handicapped room so the bathroom is big but it's old and sterile. The first room they put me in smelt of cigarettes - OK you're not allowed to smoke in rooms but this one smelt like it had. So they showed me another room on the same line - another handicapped room with the same lack of furniture and imagination. This time the AC in the room only blow out cold air even when set at 90..... Not sure how Intercontinental can let a hotel get this bad!

Reviews.Title: “A mistake”
Reviews.Author: Piyushdhawan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 5 to 8 th nov 11 with my wife and daughter . With an international brand of intercontinental  this kind of service specially from front desk is not acceptable . To start with from the moment we entered and approach the front desk they refused to have a prior reservation for us even though we had done it way in advance . After showing them the proof of reservation  by mail and much persuation they agreed . After that they were hesitant to give us good rooms . When the front desk personnel Ms Adrian swiped our card upon checkin  she charged us $1700 instead of $ 700 for 2 nights  . Upon questioning her actions she commented that this is the way we work and  need security from third world country citizens . She also commented that we do not understand the working as it is different from our back word country . The next day housekeeping did not come to the room for the whole day even after being called several times . Upon complaining about the poor service to the manager politely , we were told by Her not stay there if we were unhappy .  We were shocked by the attitude of the manager also and also were not sure of the extra 1000$ charged to our account . The next day we approached the director guest relations , she was very kind and helpful and solved all our problems with housekeeping and refunded our extra charged . Even though everything was ok at the end they she tried her best to make us comfortable at the last day , but the first two days were a nightmare which spoilt the flavour of Los Angeles . Hope it doesn't happen to anyone else .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: jennylebeouf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 3 night stay at the end of January 2012. As an RA i was upgraded to a very large Luxury Suite. A huge suite with large living room and huge bathroom. Very spectacular views of Santa Monica from the 5 different balconies! Service was excellent, from check-in (Suzie) to housekeeping, car driver, etc. The hotel is conveniently located near the Westfield mall with a number of restaurants. Also nearby is Craft, a great dining option within 7 minutes walking distance. One thing that impressed me was their elevator system. I never had to wait more than 10 seconds for an elevator to arrive. Its a small matter, but stood out to me, as i hate having to wait minutes for elevators to arrive. One disappointment was the quality of the salad at the bar, though their bloody mary was very tasty. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Lmacavinta
Reviews.Content: Was there on 1/21/12 stayed there over night after watching Wicked. Very nice Hotel, safe and great location as one would expect from an Intercontinental Hotels. a 4star indeed. Was upgraded to a mini suite. I would have given it a 5 star except. for a couple several nit picking items. one, the remote control for the TV was not working(in the living room area). Two, the coffee maker was out of order and when I called and requested for a comp. coffee and they provided it for us. Third, I expected a comp. slippers with the robe. ( marble tile is cold when you have to use the water closet in the middle of the night). Over all the room was clean and nicely decorated with a big screen TV in the living room area. The staff were nice and always willing to help. The valet was excellent ($35) per night parking had our car ready when we needed it. The hotel was not crowded at all and it was nice. My wife and I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Hope there is no fire!”
Reviews.Author: peabodymac
Reviews.Content: Beware - this hotel has all sorts shapes and sizes of rooms all for the same price so if you don't like your room, ask to see another one! Also it is much quieter on the side facing the mountains. Lastly i was there and the fire alarm went off - this hotel has NO plan to help advise, alert or direct you in the event of a fire - it was frightening! And There was NO follow- up from hotel management after the scare! On this basis alone i would NEVER sty here again, let alone book my company's business meeting there!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every moment at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ballistixx
Reviews.Content: I spent the xmas 2011 at this hotel with my family and we have titled it the best xmas ever we had everything from the hotel .. all the help possible from as little as any type of food delivery information, extra pecks for staying there with other attractions such as free valets and breakfast was splendid, we can't wait to go back.. the downside is the cost of water and internet access for mac users is not available!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggirl104
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderfull stay at the Intercontinetal. It is located in a great neighborhood. Very safe. I flew in from the east coast. We arrived at 11 am. I called the hotel and asked if we could have an early check in and they told me to come over as soon as I wanted. When we arrived they upgraded our room to a suite. Sweet! The carpet was a little outdated but the view from our room was great. You must valet but it was very convenient. The car was always waiting for us when we were ready to leave the hotel. I received a room rate that included the buffet breakfast. The breakfast was wonderful. We went to the pool every day. We usually had lunch by the pool as well. The food was GOOD. There a quite a few spaces around the hotel to relax. I satin the lobby one afternoon and read a book. There is live music in the lobby some evenings. I had a massage at the spa. It was nice. The hotel is within walking distance of the Century City Plaza. We shopped there and enjoyed lunch one afternoon. We went to the movies there too. I went jogging in the neighborhood and I felt safe. It is a great location. I wanted to stay longer. I highly recommend it and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great product, poorly presented”
Reviews.Author: dubaiman
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel, with all the facilities needed, in all a great product, but sadly let down with its direction, and that comes from the top, there is something sadly going wrong at this hotel, and as a Royal Ambassador of Intercontinental, in my opinion this hotel in no way lives up to its billing! I stayed in one of the Luxury suites, which was very nice, did have a problem with the A/C which I reported 3 times, before a engineer came, just before I was going out for a dinner reservation and decided not much he could do, he said he would report in to Duty Manager, and we went out, when we returned at 11.30pm, in our room, was engineers ladders, and sprawled all round the bedroom, was the panels he had removed and just left, not much we could do at that time, but clear a path to the bed, then at 11.45pm duty manager, called Blanca, rang my room, (who must be one of the rudest arrogant people you will ever meet) telling me I have to move room, not only that, but I have to pack up everything myself, and move myself!, I told her I would not do that at this time of night, and terminated the call, the next morning I went downstairs to speak with duty manager, at 10.00 am because i had heard nothing more, and in fact I was wrong Blanca was not the rudest most arrogant person you would ever meet, this title goes to Tim, who was today's duty manager, but he had no idea, of any problems, and in fact found it quite funny..... I ask him to contact Steve Choe, the GM, which he refused, again I insisted again he refused, eventually I had to return to my room, and EMail the GM for him to contact me. Other incidents occurred in my stay, with the service, every call to valet, room service, laundry, concierge, took 3/4 calls to get anything done. On one occasion, was booked on spa, returned back to my hotel, on day of booking to receive a call 45 minutes before appointment to say, sorry, have no therapist today, Sorry! appointment cancelled. This hotel could really be up there with the best, all the facilities are present, but there is real concerns for me with the staff at direction they are receiving. Was in hotel for 5 days, and to be honest would have left on 2nd day, but being new years Eve, most other hotels were full. but on reflection should have checked out, because even though was promised, things would get better, they never really did. Did get a chance to meet and let the GM know, (after 5 days) all problems I encountered, and he assured me he is striving to bring the standards up. The spa belongs to an outside company, so not under his control< the A/C is an ongoing problem>>>> but to me my time is too precious and I would never stay at this hotel again, and it is all down to the Staff's attitude and lack of direction and training, because as I mentioned everything is in place at this hotel. To me the first place to start, Is the GM or a suitable number 2 should be at this hotel at all times at least until all the issues that they already know about are rectified, but seems it was the holidays and everyone was off !! and the people on duty, just have no idea in running a hotel of this standard, and that is just unacceptable!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location good service”
Reviews.Author: saltsjoduvnas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at The InterContinental Century City over new years eve 2011-2012 and we are super satisfied with everything. The service was great and the location being close to West Hollywood, Beverly Hills and the coast is the best place to stay. The hotel should however consider upgrading the finish of some public areas and some rooms if they want to claim their fame.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Beverly H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for Christmas this year and ‘am already looking forward to another stay. I have always read other peoples review on this hotel and I am glad to now have a chance to add mine. Firstly, on getting to the hotel the reception was very warm and friendly. The location is FANTASTIC about 5mins walk to westfield shopping centre which I visited many times. On opening the door to the room, I was like woooow, I haven’t stayed in a room with a big balcomy and Hollywood sign to my right in my life. I felt like a celebrity. Then I ordered their dinner…PERFECT. The rooms are big and temperature control in the room is in your hands. I have never met a set of people all working together with the same attitude smiley, friendly, ready to help anytime. I didn’t mind the valet charge per day the service you get is worth more than the charge. Always have your tip on hand…not a must but I think for their warmth I didn’t mind. I could stay in the shower all morning The gym equipment, fantastic nothing broken down to be fixed. I could see the city and the pool from the gym, made me enjoy my workout. What a lovely view Breakfast …splendid The only negative comment I have about the breakfast is that on one occasion while having breakfast, one of the waiters walked past with a bin empty but uncovered and I could smell it…I almost puked,.. Then another walked past again about 5mins later this time around the bin was covered Please don’t walk past the dinning with a bin covered or uncovered while customers are having their meals. No hotel is perfect I am glad I stayed here and I will come back over and over and over again. I LOVE INTERCONTINENTAL LA

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: dlep
Reviews.Content: I've stayed on two different occasions at this hotel and I'm never disappointed! They have valet service if you need to go somewhere close and the service is fabulous! Rooms are nice and clean. Large bathroom. I stay because of the service, rooms aren't exceptional, but I'm usually not there to stay in the room. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Reduced Price”
Reviews.Author: psjayne
Reviews.Content: We knew that we would be charged for parking at $36.& $12./day. Location is excellent. Room was clean and nicely appointed. It had a fabulous view and the weather was fantastic. Bring lots of singles and $5 bills as tipping is expected and you do a lot of it. Smoking is not permitted in the room, but it is permitted on the balcony. If you don't mind paying $5.50 for the individual size small bottles of Evian then don't bring your own water for coffee - which is brewed by a Kreurig. Bed was very comfortable. Why these hotels don't use fitted sheets? Yes we would stay there again knowing all of this, but for a price of not more than $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent”
Reviews.Author: iwy424
Reviews.Content: The room, service, and location were all fantastic. The complimentary hotel car for short trips was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Start but shame about the Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ali B
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotel after a very long flight from Uk to LAX. we were met by a charming valet and went into the beautiful reception. we had one huge problem at the begining that our rooms were situated about 300 yards apart. after asking for interconecting rooms as two of our children were staying away from us, this was very poor. the staff were helpful and managed to get us another nicer room only 100 yards away which was acceptable. the beds were absolutely divine and the swimming pool and hot tub we used on the first morning was lovely. the breakfast although extortionately expensive was brilliant. overall a nice stay.. but they could improve their booking system

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in November and enjoyed my stay. The carpet was worn and stained. The room had a musty smell. The Bar was decent and the Restaurant was very large but had no room for seating in the morning. The front desk was very efficient. There was a charge for parking as usual in the area.

Reviews.Title: “They messed up our booking so upgraded us....”
Reviews.Author: lachaplin
Reviews.Content: Cant really give 5/5 as they messed up our booking. Basically we booked a twin room and they only had a doulbe, reason being that they had a group of guests that wanted to stay longer so they kept our room. To be honest, ive never heard anything so ridiculous in my life and the Woman (night manager who's name I cannot remember - began with an A), was the most patronising and rude Woman I have ever come across. She told us there were no other options and it was this or nothing. You dont pay for a burger and just get a bun!! Anyway, she gave us a Junior suite which only had one bed, so we complained again and got free parking and a king suite which was amazing. Therefore we were happy in the end, but I do think the Woman should be sacked for being so rude. Doesn't really deserve to deal with customers. The room was nice, beds were big and comfy and the hotel was so clean. The pool was great and the gym was like being in a fitness centre. Location was ok, right next to a mall, but a while from Hollywood. Would stay again I spose...

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SeaviewKing15
Reviews.Content: 1. The bad We had a handicapped room on 3rd floor. The shower would flood most of the bathroom floor after one use. WiFi fee (Apple store is an easy walk for free WiFi) Parking $36/day, No other nearby alternatives. Also with valet only, I tipped every time someone got the car (I guessed this was expected) Wet bar items very expensive 2. The good Beautiful facility with very attractive public spaces Nice pool and health club Nice restaurant and bar Staff was very courteous and helpful Valet parking has in and out priviledges. Our car was available in minutes. Very clean rooms Comfortable rooms with balconies. Very comfortable bed. Room near elevator was quiet. Never heard elevator. One free bottled water supplied daily. Extra bottled water very expensive but labeled with price. Newspapers available in lobby/restaurant Some free coffee and tea in room. Large flat screen TV Excellent location in Century City. Walking distance to mall and restaurants. Bus stops at mall.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok but expected better”
Reviews.Author: Crystal K
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here from the 10th-15th November this year. When we pulled up to the hotel it looked as if it was in the middle of no-where with nothing to do although we had read reviews that it was right next to rodeo drive (not true) and fox studios (true- right next door). The hotel lobby was lovely and the outside areas too and i would give them a 5star rating. However, when we went to check in they said our room wasn't ready and we would need to wait half an hour although half an hour turned into an hour and a half which my friend and i weren't happy with. To make matters worse we were told we would need to pay a deposit? We said we had already paid for everything and the manager then said it's just for them and they'll give us it back when we check out so we thought that's fine until the woman said 500 dollars between us!!! We were shocked as previous to los angeles we had been in Las Vegas and had budgeted our money for both trips as we needed to take into consideration food as well as day trips etc! We sat outside annoyed as we had lost out on 250 dollars each but i asked to speak to the manager and got us 100 dollars each back and the manager explained that it was their hotel policy (something that our travel agent hadn't warned us. about)! The manager also explained that it is usually only 100 dollars but didn't explain why she was charging us 150 more and at first 250 but my friend said because we were 2 young girls and that will probably be the reason why! We are 24 years of age so i would warn people in their mid 20s to budget for this as well if making a trip to La and staying at this hotel. When we got to our hotel room my friend said wasn't a five star room and it was not, i would grade the rooms about a 3 star on decor etc. However the rooms were cleaned and the beds made every day with fresh towels left out. We ate in the hotel quite a lot and i would recommend the spaghetti bolognese. The waiters and waitresses were lovely and catered to your every need. It wasn't expensive either for a hotel that has been awarded 5 stars, we were 70 dollars for 2 spaghetti bolognese and 2 ice-creams plus a coke each. When we ordered 2 spaghetti bolognese without dessert or drinks to the room it was 90 dollars as you need to pay vat, a service charge and something else. We felt as if some of the hotel staff looked down on us probably as they expect famous faces or extremley rich people staying in their hotel although back home we come from privleged backgrounds so it wasn't nice of them to make us feel like that. Not once did the bar staff or restaurant staff make us feel like that though. We had booked to do the grand tour of La with Vip tours which i would totally recommend! They pick you up from your hotel and bring you back at night. The tour consists of visiting the main attractions of Los angeles so get your cameras ready as there are lots of photo opportunities! We done Universal the next day and that was great too! However, we weren't too impressed with Disney as there wasn't much to do. We also went to Santa Monica beach which was great, nice food and shops! The Ferris wheel situated on the beach also provides you with good photo ops!! On our arrival we thought the hotel wasn't near anything, however it is actually only a ten minute walk from a shopping centre called Westfield which has various shops and restuarants plus a cinema. Shops include Macys, Bloomingdales, Zara, H&M, Victorias secret, Juicy...! There is also places to eat that would cater for all budgets. There is a big grocery store on the ground floor as well which is open to 11pm and opens around 10am. There is also a bus stop when you walk out of the hotel and turn onto the main road where entrance to fox studios is and for a dollar bus (big blue bus) takes you to Santa Monica beach. The chauffeur service was good but sometimes there was a queue to use the service but there are taxis outside so if you don't feel like walking to the mall it's only 5 dollars in a taxi which you would give to the chauffeur anyway. The chauffeur service finishes at 9pm weekdays, not sure about a Saturday and the Sunday we were there he finished at 5.30pm. On a whole we felt welcome by some staff, dining in the restaurant was reasonable, the rooms were clean, the hotel was near transport to go to different places and there was a mall 10mins away. I wouldn't rate this to my friends or to families but to older couples or groups of older friends looking to get away for a quiet and relaxing holiday. Next time i would stay in Santa Monica as the location is great and it is so central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: 81FrequentT81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business. The first room they gave me was boiling hot even though the thermometer read 68. I asked for a different room. They moved me right away to an identical room. After a cross-country flight, all I wanted was to snack on Pringles and soak in the bathtub. Pringles were tasty but there were several black hairs in the tub so I didn't want to use it :( Everything else about the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Expensive Wi-Fi...”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very well located, with easy access to highways, shopping mall and restaurants area. But still expensive, in all senses...food...valet, and they don't offer wi fi for free as many pricey hotels do... check other options if you are in the LA area... Also I stayed at room 1420 and is located right beside the service area door. They talk loud, move things all day...so if you are sleeping you could be upset...

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Vacationqueen84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October for a trade show. Hotel is impressive and convenient for all attractions around Beverly Hills. Not convenient if you have to get to the convention center, although there was a shuttle available at certain times. Food good; I had breakfast and a lunch there although not inexpensive. As my husband is an Ambassodor status with Priority Club we were given a very nice upgrade to a suite. Finally, I really need to mention the 2 concierges, Nyree and Gregory who were both excellent in booking restaurants and helping with questions etc. We had 2 Italian clients that we wanted to impress and they did a great job! Overall, I was very happy with our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: island__exile50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. I upgraded to a small suite - was nice to have a separate bedroom. Desk and working environment was good - plus it was nice to have a balcony. Bathroom was a great size and had a separate shower. The restaurant service was very friendly, breakfasts were excellent and evening meal was good. Was too tired to explore the area properly or seek out other food in the vicinity. Didn't have the chance to try the health club or pool (despite having picked a hotel with these). Would I stay there again - yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer care”
Reviews.Author: N2NY
Reviews.Content: The hotel wins high honors for taking very good care of its guests -- from check-in to check-out, they try to make everything pleasurable, easy, professional and comfortable. Room was comfortable and immaculate; view was spectacular. Very quiet. Very upscale. Only downsides: valet parking (the only choice available) was very expensive but was also very well run; room service was very expensive as well, but staff is wondereful; air unit was a bit noisy. Fortunately I booked via Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Kasha G
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Intercontinental. Clean, nice designs, and the staff were great. Also, I think that was the most comfortable hotel bed I have every slept it. I actually got a good night's rest! I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetence abounds”
Reviews.Author: Sharon L
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, but.....We reserved two rooms for four business colleagues. The price for double occupancy was the same as single. Only three of us were able to come. The front desk COULD NOT FIGURE OUT how to allow one occupant in each room to pay the entire bill for the room. Surprise, when I got home my business manager called me to ask what this extra charge on the corporate credit card was that we had no receipt for?! A room cancellation charge. We reserved 2 rooms, we paid for 2 rooms. It took four phone calls to clear this up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Centrally Located hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel with my husband. We had a great time. The property was clean, the rooms were comfortable, and the staff had an overall friendly attitude. Would recommend to friends and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to UCLA”
Reviews.Author: Territhetripp
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel and close to Hollywood, Wetwood and UCLA. We got a great deal on Priceline and got the room for about half the price. The service is topp notch and they even upgraded us to a suite. good FREE fitness center also.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and excellent views!”
Reviews.Author: minkewhaleNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and was impressed with the standard of the room and service in general. The hotel is some way away from the main tourist area of Hollywood Boulevard, just out from Beverly Hills. I didn't have a car so was restricted to public transport, which is not convenient in LA, but fortunately the hop-on hop-off bus has a stop right outside the hotel, which enabled me to see most of the sights without having to take taxis. You can also take a bus to Santa Monica in 20 minutes from outside the Fox Studios down the road, and there is an open air shopping centre with a variety of restaurants just around the corner. Our room had a balcony looking out over LA and the Holywood sign in the hills, which was fantastic. The bathroom was large with separate bath and shower, and there was a great coffee machine with free coffee pods in the room. You can get free coffee in the lounge until 10 a.m. (although the nice man at the bar offered to serve me free coffee after this!). They also offer a zumba class on the helipad on a Tuesday evening! I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not as they promote!”
Reviews.Author: gabrielacero
Reviews.Content: Hotel was dingy and overrated! Their Facebook will promote a suave hotel but gives nothing more than a motel 6 with valet parking. 1. Valet fee was hefty and that was not including the valet attendant tip. You are not able to park your own car. So every time you leave you have to keep tipping tipping and tipping. 2. The turn down service skipped a night. 3. The room was dirty, stained, burned carpet marks, warped wallpaper, dirty caulking around sink, dusty. -- We are even Ambassadors and we were treated like entry level guest. The valet attendants’ were strong tone at times when asking for the car. The room service display resembled IHOP. We've made it a choice not to return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal service & $36 valet”
Reviews.Author: trinigypsy
Reviews.Content: Positives - clean room, good views and we got a great rate on hotwire. Negatives - $36.30 valet parking fee/night, impersonal service. I booked a room for 3pple and was told that the hotel only had double beds so it was quite tight. I was told that I opted for the internet on the 2nd day at 4pm even though I was out the entire day from 12pm to 2am. When I disputed the charge, the guy at the desk (very, very 'begrudgingly') took it off. I didn't get a "thank-you for staying" or "would you like to an envelope for your receipt??" or nothing. He gave me the receipt and walked away. For someone with a job in the hospitality industry! Seriously????? Simply awful service.

Reviews.Title: “Typical LA Hype”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many Intercontinental hotels and this one was pretty middle of the road. We drove in and were greeted abruptly by the valet and told there was no self parking so be prepared to pay $35 a day plus tips.The check in was pretty impersonal even though we're Ambassador Club members, there are no club facilities at this site. The rooms are a highlight and amongst the best we experienced in the USA. There are limited resturant facilities on site but plenty of options walking distance at the Westfield Centre or a short drive to Beverley Hills. Good location if you have a car for most of the LA highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: newtonseye
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we have ever stayed in, in the usa part of a road trip that took us all over the west of the USA 12 hotels in 20 days. The location is right next to the fox studios and a block from a shopping centre.The service here was impeccable, they could not do enough for us. the hotel itself most mostly clean but a bit tired in places, the room we were given had a massive comfortable bed, although the fixtures and fitting seemed a bit jaded.The parking was expensive, but there are few places to park in this area and the nearest other car park was a good walk from hotel. a functional comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff, dated property”
Reviews.Author: Sarabean_11
Reviews.Content: Good location for business, and the staff are great. The rooms are kind of institutional though. Fairly large but old furniture and finishes. The furniture is a bit banged up, but fine. Just not a super high end experience. Fitness room is ok -- I'd say 8-10 cardio machines and a few weight machines. It overlooks the pool and hot tub area which is clean but unfortunately looks out over a parking garage. Breakfast was good and on time and the delivery guy great. There is a mall about a 10 min walk away with several restaurants and lots of stores. Hotel bar is not great for single travelers -- more of a lounge with lots of tables. They do a nice happy hour thing with food and some music though. All in, nothing negative to say, just doesn't quite live up to the intercontinental image.

Reviews.Title: “Most arrogant managers in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: InaF
Reviews.Content: I just have to start this review by pointing out that despite the fact that this hotel is simply beautiful, its managers are horrendous or at least the ones I dealt with. I have never met such arrogant people working with customer services. I thought the Intercontinental hotel chain employs highly professional employees, but the range of reception managers I encountered made me think twice about their employment procedure. They don’t listen, they are not polite, they ignore you and are only concerned with payments. They actually spend more time with one’s credit card than with the hotel guest him/herself. I was just appalled by their attitude. As far as the hotel is concerned, its location is far from the important tourist attractions, but the hotel offers a free limousine service to/from Rodeo Drive. However, close by, there is a shopping centre and not far from the hotel you have Beverly Hills. The lobby is large and beautifully decorated with fresh flowers. Sometimes it gets busy due to conferences/meetings/events and it may seem that the quietness and privacy of the hotel is gone. There is also a pool and the hotel offers several eating areas. The hotel also has what appears to be a small inner court, which is worth a visit. The concierge desk is very helpful, but be aware of other guests, because some of them have never heard of something called queuing. I opted for a room with sundeck, which left me with a massive bedroom/sitting area, an enormous bathroom, double balcony, a very quiet corner of the hotel and most importantly, I had the best LA view from my 11th floor, overlooking not only Beverly Hills, but also Downtown LA and the famous Hollywood sign. So, half of my sightseeing was done while eating breakfast on the balcony. The hotel hits all the right notes for business and pleasure (apart from the managers).

Reviews.Title: “Classy staff, classy property -- hits all the right notes for business AND pleasure travel”
Reviews.Author: Lynn V
Reviews.Content: We hit on the IC quite by accident when our usual hotel down the street -- which shall go nameless but reminds me of a casting call for "Idol" -- was filled. I, for one, will never go back. The IC is elegant but unpretentious; a place where "adults" of all ages can meet for a business meeting or drink and actually DO business, but more than hip enough to impress those looking for a Hollywood feel. Decor is modern and serene. LOVE the lobby treatment and the Asian inspired, coordinated flower arrangements. Rooms and bathrooms are large and well appointed -- uber comfy bed. EXCELLENT fitness center and pool -- a real stand-out feature for road-warriors, as is the walking distance proximity to the Westfield Mall. The really distinctive feature abut this property, however, is the staff. On my third trip back I was not only greeted by name but with real smiles of recognition from the concierge and friendly wait staff in the Grill Park. As a result, the IC has become my home LA hotel, and indeed it is now the LA hotel of choice for our entire organization. Special kudos to the group sales staff, which has made me and my team look good in front of our management and entertainment industry clients with their attention to detail (esp "welcome" treatement for our VIPs) and willingness to think creatively about meeting space, parties, etc. Highly recommend this hotel for business OR pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars - great hospitality, rooms large but dated”
Reviews.Author: KipL
Reviews.Content: We got a great price deal & it was worth it. Lobby, restaurant layout & pool nice. Trendy pool scene. Staff very helpful. Rooms were just okay. Nice feature is mercedes complementary car service in one mike radius.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 44musicman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient to most LA areas. Great outdoor parklike area. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lolo6994
Reviews.Content: I stay here a couple times a year on business and never fail to be impressed. The lobby is lovely and the Grill Park restaurant is great for business meetings and dinners. There is a nice bar with a good wine list and great service. In the rightt room, you can get a nice view of Beverly Hills. A sleek black Mercedes 550s is available to take guests to the nearly Westfield Mall or nearby restaurants. Make time for a massage in their relaxing spa. They also have a well-equipped gym and an outdoor pool. Many of the rooms have balconies where you can sip coffee in the morning and read the paper. A nice way to relax before hitting the streets,

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, but stay away from rooms with adjoining doors”
Reviews.Author: kkrrr
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was beautiful, though older. Looks like they are doing some interior redesign from the newer pictures. Staff was very professional and friendly. Initially we were put in a room with a wrap around balcony and sweeping views of the city. Absolutely gorgeous. At night however, the sound from next door came through the adjoining door. Our neighbor had left his TV on and gone out around midnight. We complained and security knocked on the door and eventually went in and turned the TV off. Security said to their suprise the TV wasn't on that loud, so I assume it was because the TV was near the adjoining door. We had fallen asleep until our neighbor returned and turned the TV back on. I didn't want to bother the neighbor since I didn't think he was doing anything unreasonable, so I went down to talk to the front desk and they gave us a suite on one of the top floors with a large roof top deck area for sunning. Loved it. Upon check out, the manager mentioned he would put a note in our file for our next visit to give us a room without an adjoining door. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lclarknj1
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Located on the west side of LA, this hotel makes for a good home base for exploring. As other reviewers have noted, you can be in Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, or downtown LA in a matter of minutes. My room was in the front of the hotel and the "Hollywood" sign was directly in our viewing area. Sweet! Hotel is nicely maintained with lots of fresh flowers in the lobby. There are several outdoor seating areas, featuring heat lamps or fire pits - nice for cool CA evenings. Room was nice, with a comfortable bed and linens. Flat screen TV and the outrageously priced mini bar (stay away!) Bathroom was large and well-appointed. Two fluffy robes were provided. I'd say that it is about time for a freshening up, though, for the whole place, as the carpet is looking a bit dated and several areas would have benefitted from a new coat of paint. It is not an inexpensive stay, and anything you order from any of the restaurants or bars will not be, either. It is LA, though, so just be aware. Service: Everyone we encountered was polite, professional, and very helpful. All seemed genuinely interested in making my stay as positive as possible. Parking: $33.00 - ouch - and you need to specify that you want in and out privileges. As there are few places to walk, you'll need a vehicle. Restaurant: We didn't dine or use room service, but there are restaurants on site. Sunday was busy, although there was no one in any of the dining areas on Saturday night. Facilities: There is a well-equipped 24-hour fitness center, which is free to guests, as is the outdoor pool. There is also a spa, with services for purchase. Area attractions: Although I am not sure which, a trolley tour stops right outside on almost an hourly basis. There is an outdoor mall about 5 blocks away, featuring all the usual suspects (Banana Republic, Macy’s, Nordstrom’s, Bloomies, etc) as well as a food court and 4 sit-down restaurants. LA has an awesome farmer's market/shopping area at Third Street & Rexford. You can eat just about any cuisine your heart - or stomach - desires, from Spanish to Mexican to French to Cajun to....you get the drift. Walk around, take in all the choices, then decide. There are several small bands that play on Saturday night, and the whole thing becomes very festive. Right behind it is an outdoor mall, featuring most of the places named at the mall earlier.. Easy drive to Beverly Hills & Rodeo Drive... Take a ride up to the Griffith Observatory for some breathtaking views!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kakridge
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Intercontinental Los Angeles Century City. Excellent view overlooking Hollywood Hills and Beverly Hills. A great place to relax and enjoy their outdoor pool and jacuzzi, as well as their well equipped gym. The lobby area is beautiful with an excellent Grill Park Restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner and cocktail lounge. Location is about 5 minutes from Beverly Hills and about 10 minutes from the Hollywood scene. Convenient to Santa Monica Beach, approximately 25 minutes. The rooms are very spacious with extra large bathrooms. Room service is excellent and all the employees have excellent upbeat attitudes. Highly recommended, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityCEO
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before when it was a Park Hyatt. Great location to Rodeo, shopping mall in walking distance. I arrived driving a rental car a hyundai rental car and there seems to be a different treatment for those driving more expensive cars - i.e. Mercedes S Class - Which I just happen to own. Check-in was good although I was asuming that they knew I was a platinum with Priority Club - I later learned that was not the case. Platinum members get an upgrade (if available) at check-in and a weekday news paper and i got neither. I was there for one night so no big deal I just thought that I would mention it at check out. The male checking me out told me that platinum members don't get upgrades that is only for Ambassador Members. Clearly their front desk staff does not know membership levels which could explain why i did not get any. He said that there was no paper mentioned in my profile so he added one for me.
