Nice pool, steam room locker room and breakfast. The Concierge staff need to be a little more down to earth as they were snooty despite the fact that they are actaully working there and not guest. You do want an upscale feel but there is a thing called being friendly. The hotel decor is dated and showing age. Still very clean but the hallway carpet shows wear and is noticable. The headboard and wallpapers in the rooms could use an update. Still loved the hotel and it's location! Had dinner at Houston's but had to cut my trip short and did not visit Rodeo or the Museum of Tolerance.

Reviews.Title: “Another good visit”
Reviews.Author: Mcannie
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel in great location. Delighted the rooms are so cheap & offer good value for money for such a quality product. A trendy, popular hotel with a fab pool area. Rooms lovely & staff are nice. Downside - cost of cocktails by the pool & the charge for overnight parking, ouch!!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Intercontinental in upscale LA location”
Reviews.Author: jn1952
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay at Intercontinental in Century City area of LA courtesy of Priceline. The hotel was rated four stars and deserves the rating. Hotel lobby and common areas are very nice and rooms were generous although beds were doubles rather than queens. Bathroom is spacious and had separate bath and shower. Location is a ten minute walk to Westfield Mall which has many shops and places to eat. Only negative is parking. Valet only option, $36 per night with tax and there is no on-street or public parking anywhere near the hotel. Other than that it was a very, very nice hotel with staff attentive and helpful. Nice outdoor pool on second floor. Last morning of our stay they were shooting a TV show in the lobby between 6 and 7 a.m. That was cool.............bunch of people all dressed up for a "pretend" wedding reception. Was a little out of place in my morning "walking" gear but nobody seemed to care.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: travlinman525_8
Reviews.Content: Great location near Beverly Hills and 20 minutes from Santa Monica or LAX. Got a great rate through Hotwire.com for a weekend stay. This hotel is much busier during the week so I got into my room at noon AND received an upgrade. Room was very elegant, lovely bathroom with twin lavatories, robes, etc. My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful breakfast the next morning. My only complaint was the $36.00 valet parking fee. I suppose when your company is paying for it, it doesn't matter but we had two cars so...ouch! Other than that, however, we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back for another staycation!”
Reviews.Author: msbout
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our experience at this hotel. The entire holiday weekend was so relaxing, calm and the staff was a huge part of that. From the front desk, the bell desk, the in house driver Melkon, concierge to the room service and pool staff, we encountered nothing but friendly, helpful service. The hotel is really well done and peaceful. The new pool was amazing since it has a non-slip bottom and an infinity pool type feel. We were there attending a wedding but made a little staycation out of it. Our corner room was wonderful and plan on requesting it again next time. The bathroom needs a bit of updating but it was a nice size with a separate tub. Floor to ceiling windows and a balcony. WOW. Also, the room service food was so yummy! We stayed at another hotel for the last leg of our trip as it was closer to another event and let me tell you the room service was so yucky after having the food at the intercontinental hotel. The only negative thing and what I would make a note of is the "Valet Only: policy and the $36 per day/overnight parking rate. I know its the area and all but that is just an exorbitant amount of money. We dropped off our luggage, parked about 10 minutes away and never went to the car again. The hotel car take you anywhere at about 1.5 mile radius around. Anything farther will require a cab. Minus this, our stay was perfect and I don’t say that easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Crustiviajero
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel after reading such wonderful reviews: our idea was to have a quick visit of Los Angeles after a three week trip in the West Coast and Hawaii... Honestly, the hotel is fine but not spectacular... The rooms are OK but a little bit outdated. Internet was not free of charge: why in a motel 6 it is free and not in a 5* hotel? We had dinner two times within the hotel: one time in the restaurant and the other in the lobby bar. The food was OK but extremelly slow. The first night we have to wait 1h15 for a salmon and a steak!! Hopefully the waiter was very very nice, he apologyzed many times and offer us a complimentary glass of wine. The kitchen is something that they have to check as on the day we were leaving we had to wait for another 45' for two hamburguers... On the other hand, at night, in the looby bar has a sushi bar that is fine and fast :) In general, the staff from the hotel are very nice and cool. The hotel is located in Century City very close to Beverly Hills. If you want to go to Downtown or Venice/Santa Monica beach there are several bus lines near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL BUT CHECK IN WAS A NIGHTMARE AND FOOD WAS TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1944
Reviews.Content: CHECK IN: Arrived 9.30am after a 14 hour flight and had to wait for over 3 1/2 hours for our room to be available. I advised the Duty Manager that Royal Ambassador members are guaranteed an 8am check in and a 4pm late checkout. If the booked room type is not available then another room type must be made available. This is the Royal Ambassador guarantee. After checking in I printed out the Abmassador Membership terms and conditions and presented it to the Duty Manager. After apologizing for making us wait for over 3 1/2 hours he conceeded that I was correct and included the buffett breakfast for us. I have noted that many hotels in the IC group have this unwritten rule that they will not allow anyone to check in prior to 12noon even if there is a room available. Events as indicated above only happen because of poor staff training. Housekeeping is open from 8am and during our wait for room availability we witnessed over 15 groups checking out and over 8 interviews for job applications! With 10% unemployment in the USA and 45 million people reliant on food stamps I would think that you could have better management suitably employed. There is no check in counter for Priority Club or Ambassador members and there is no mention of these two programmes at the front reception area. SECURITY: Anyone can walk into the hotel lobby and take the lift to any floor without the use of a key card - there is no security. In room safes are free standing and not attached to anything - you could place one in any suitcase and walk out of the building with it. I mentioned this to the front office and they put me through to security and they indicated to me they did not think it was a problem as the hotel was in a safe area. So, the mentality is that you wait for an incident to happen and then you address the problem Like closing the gate after the horse has escaped! CLUB FLOOR: None available which is very disappointing for an IC Hotel. POSITION: Located in a nice area suitable for walking or jogging. RESTAURANTS AND SHOPPING: Westfield Mall is a 15 minute walk from the hotel and Rodeo Drive is about a 30 minute walk from the hotel. Would recommend BJ’s at Westfield for a nice meal at great prices and a good menu choice. The hotel has a complimentary drop off and pick up service within a 5 mile radius from the hotel. TRANSPORT: Taxi fare from LAX airport to the hotel is approx. US$45. FOOD: Buffett breakfast is Approx US$31 per person inclusive of tax plus an 18% gratuity which is added to the bill. However, the hot section (which has exactly the same choice each day) only includes chip potatoes, bacon and scrambled eggs which are set hard (like concrete) in the heated tray. This would be the worst buffett breakfast I have ever had at any Intercontinental hotel ever. (As indicated above complimentary breakfast was included for us - and I think it should be at US$375 per night). OVERVIEW: Probably the best area to stay in LA would be Santa Monica which is on the beach and has many shops and restaurants in the area. If your first stop is at the Pier area then you will be very disappointed as you must go back along the main restaurant shopping area to appreciate Santa Monica. The Hop on Hop off LA bus stops at the pier so you can use this facility to go to all the main tourist areas in LA. Checked out the Holiday Inn in this area but would not recommend it as it is just like a pimple on a pumpkin and is bounded on three sides by very busy noisy streets. Also has very small rooms. They also never answer any e-mail requests for information. The Hop On Hop Off bus also stops directly outside the Intercontinental Hotel, however, it goes via Sana Monica and takes over an hour to get to the Hollywood Walk of Fame area which is the stop where you need to change buses to go to the other 3 loopes included in the ticket price.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: JerryP84
Reviews.Content: Arriving out of the car to the front desk the hotel appeared to be very beautiful. After dealing with the front desk and front desk manager (Blanca?) I rather put a screw in my eye than come back to this hotel. Day 1. Found cockroach in my bathroom. Killed the bug. left it in the toliet. Called front desk and they sent security do inspect? Security? I have no understanding as to why security would come. When he came he said I shouldn't have killed it , but instead kept it confined to that security could take it. Bizarre. No apologies or offer to change the room Day 2. - Air Conditioning goes out. Called front desk and they sent an engineer to fix air conditioning. 1 hr later the air conditioning was fixed. Again no apologies from the front desk manager Blanca. Day 3- Ray-Ban Sunglass Stolen out of Room. Spoke to Blanca again and she told me that I should ask the other person in the room or a friend from another room if they had taken them. I was so annoyed, did she not think that I would ask my friends if they had taken them before calling her to report them missing. Filled out a claim form and have yet to receive contact from them. Received a phone call from Blanca saying that nobody had entered my room according to the security logs that monitor my room's electronic key identifier. Now I don't want to accuse housekeeping of taking them, but I vividly remember putting my glasses on next to the tv after opting to use a different pair of sunglasses for the day. Day 4- My key card would not open the door. I went up and down to the lobby 4 times to get a new key. Blanca the manager said to me, " I dont know what your issue is all you have to do is slide the key in the door and it will open". Well Blanca i'm not a 5 year old I know how keys work. After trying the fourth time they had an engineer come up and took 2 hours to reprogram and replace the electronic card access panel from the door. At this point I was fed up. I called Blanca and told her this was unacceptable and that I demand an apology and a credit to be compensated for all the issues I had. Blanca very unpleasantly offered to credit our room free internet for the day. What a joke. I told her that I don't need internet access that I didn't bring my laptop and that I have a phone with internet service. She then told me that even if i use my phone that I would have to pay for internet access on the phone. This lady is crazy. After going back and forth for 10 minutes she offered me breakfast for one person. Mind you that 2 people are staying in my room. I will never be back to this place. The service was horrible. We paid a lot of money to be stay at this hotel. Next time I visit L.A. I will be staying at the Hyatt Century Plaza, two seconds away from the Intercontinental, i've had far more pleasant experiences there. Stay AWAY from this hotel!! P.S. The pool doesn't really look the pictures off the website. Far less quality!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with a warm and welcoming staff determined to make your stay a special one.”
Reviews.Author: TomGLaw
Reviews.Content: From the moment your vehicle pulls into the driveway of this beautifully designed and very well managed hotel, you will know you are truly a guest and not merely a customer. Parking attendants, bellmen, frontdesk personnel, housekeeping staff, the telephone operator -- each, it seems, wants you to know that this is a happy place and your happiness is the objective of his or her work. Perhaps this is most obvious in the dining areas, where each staff member offered a cheery welcome and courteous attention in an elegant room where Assistant Manager Laura Vezan seemed ever present to offer cheerful oversight of the service of highest quality food and drink. In every way, this luxury hotel is committed to making the classic hotelier's mission its own: "to invite someone is to take charge of his happiness while he is under your roof." Five stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, but...”
Reviews.Author: Saralpo
Reviews.Content: I booked on Priceline and got a good deal. The room was very nicely decorated and comfortable. We were on a low floor which was fine except for the gravel roofed area outside our window. Nobody goes out and cleans off the stuff that falls or drops out of the windows. PLEASE. Also, there was a cigarette hole in the comforter and I was allergic to something in that room. The parking was exorbitant! $108 for three nights! It negated my Priceline bargain. I was told that the upper floors can face the Fox lot, that might have been nice. They did offer wine to guests the night we arrived, and have a pretty pool area and good fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: mcdermov
Reviews.Content: Picked hotel based on location (close to Beverly Hills, midway between Santa Monica and Hollywood). It did not disappoint in this regard, but the adjacent Westbury (? correct name) shopping center was one of the biggest adjantages of the location, and it is of note the the nearby Hyatt is closer to the mall. A previous review suggested the Intercontinental was on a quieter street, but in fact both are on Ave of the Stars. We did not eat in the hotel, or use the pool. Parking is valet and not cheap at $35 per day. Rooms are very nice and service standards up to the 4 star listing. I would stay with Intercontinental again but if returning to this location may try the Hyatt next time because of its marginally closer location to the mall, with its restaurants, movie theatres etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Lovely staff especially Jesse the Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Lena S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, really friendly helpful staff especially Jesse who was so helpful and informative. Got an upgrade which was great as we were a family of 4. Hotel was very clean, the rooms were excellent and the beds so comfortable. Will definitely return to this wonderful hotel. A very happy Irish Family.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to LA/Santa Monica”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our trip by flying into LA from UK, we hired a car and stayed at the Intercontinental Los Angeles on Avenue of the Stars. This hotel was very nice, we had our room upgraded by staff on our arrival, staff were very pleasant. We visited Santa Monica Pier which was a big let down for us, we now regret not starting our trip from Las Vegas instead of LA. This hotel is much too far out of the way from anywhere, although it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: OzyFreddles
Reviews.Content: A great hotel that knows customer service and how to ensure a customer comes back. Upgraded room on check-in, and when I mentioned I was flying out late to Australia the following evening with no prompting I was informed I could have a 6pm check out if I so desired. Excellent service throughout, well provisioned extremely comfortable large rooms. Walking distance to the local Mall, and some very good restaurants. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to LA

Reviews.Title: “A hotel staff that knows how to make you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: NYCEntertainmentAtty
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel probably 10-15 times in the last three years for one single reason: The Staff. Indeed, it was this property which set the standard by which I have come to judge other hotels. In 2007, I booked a suite for a business trip because at the time I had Gold status with the Six Continents loyalty program (now it's Priority Club). When I arrived for check in, I requested and was given an upgrade to a large suite for an additional $100 per night. The additional cost was well worth it. Upon arrival, I also took special care to tip the valet and bellman well - which I highly recommend if you ever wish to return to a hotel. They took extra care to learn my name and where I was from. Throughout the entire trip there was not one time I entered the hotel without having someone greet me by name. The 1,200 Sq.ft. Luxury Suite I was given was like an apartment, complete with views of the Hollywood sign. Each time I drove in to valet my car, the attendants literally ran to the vehicle to greet me and open the door. I completed my business and was so impressed with the hotel and service that I decided to return several months later with my wife and our dog (who is a certified therapy dog). My subsequent visits all lived up to my high expectations and my wife loves both the service, the location and the luxuriously spacious rooms. Indeed, as a direct result of my multiple stays at this single property, I reached Platinum status with IHG and later opted in to pay for the Ambassador service (something I highly recommend). We alos frequently order breakfast in the room and the food is fantastic. They have the BEST coffee. I continue to frequent the property and have experienced only one minor hiccup with the Front Desk staff - who surprisingly were less familiar with who I was than the bellmen, valet attendants and room service waiters. I spoke with a manager about it and the problem was immediately rectified by manager dSteve Choe Ever since, I have used this hotel as my de facto West Coast home base for all of my entertainment-related client activities. What makes this hotel great is that it has allowed me to fly my wife out for several weekends so that I can convert a long week business trip into a mini-vacation. Beverly Hills and the Westfield Century City mall are just blocks away and the hotel even offers chauffeur service to the mall and local stores upon request. If you are planning a trip to Los Angeles and are wiling to invest in becoming loyal to a property, then this is the hotel to do it at. There appears to be little turn-over with the key staff and If you take the initiative to get to know and treat them well, they will most certainly reciprocate and provide you with the type of service that only Five Diamond properties are known for offering. Our last stay at the hotel in June 2011 was no different and I am already looking forward to spending Labor Day weekend there with my wife and our Cavalier King Charles Spaniel -whose tail never stops wagging from the time we pull up to this hotel until we leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle0404
Reviews.Content: Hotel great huge rooms! Excellent pool - views over fox studios! Limited food and bev options though and location need a car but I guess that"s LA!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: MomMarietta_GA
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great outdoor patio which was great. The concierge was very helpful with directions and the hotel car for short, local rides. We enjoyed the pool and the spa as well. Despite being very busy we never saw any signs of strain. Their service seemed effortless.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lovesvacation97
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean and well maintained. The rooms smelled good when you enter which is fabulous!!! The check in process was smooth and check in personnel very pleasant , friendly and shows professionalism. My daughters 11 and 9 and husband truly enjoyed our stayed here. Excellent location and service!

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip to LA - Loved this Hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to LA. The hotel was fantastic. We had a huge room with a great balcony. The view was great, the service was great, the pool was great. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel itself, but were very comfortable while at the hotel. The people working at the hotel were so nice. We really loved our time here and would love to go back for another weekend.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL- AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: ajowen91
Reviews.Content: Several Things at this hotel are terrible 1- Luggage left outside on courtyard for over an hour 2- Un-able to check in at the designated 2pm timeslot 3- Staff not as sociabal as those at other hotels of the same "standard" 4- Size of the superiour room not so superiour 5- Bad location for dining out 6- Prices of food and drink are cheaper else where 7- no complimentary products such as water ort snacks 8- mould in the bathroom 9- layers of dust 10- faulty shwer head 11- iron doesn't work 12- tempromental air conditioning unit 13- not worth it's $239 per night value 14- too cut off from the outside world 15- NOT WORTH A STAR RATING AS HIGH- NO WHERE NEAR AS GOOD AS PLACES LIKE THE HOLIDAY INN NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL- ABSOLUTE DUMP AND NOT WORTH IS "VALUE" ROOMS ARE TOO SMALL AND CRAMPED AND THE FOOD AND DRINK IS ALSO OF POOR STANDARD

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: barbaraPasoRobles_CA
Reviews.Content: excellent service, luxury but family friendly, wish we could live here, kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Hotel for Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: TheBayou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July 2011. The rooms are nice and the location is good if you need to be in the Century City/Beverly Hills area. However, the hotel doesn't function well when it comes to business. 1. There is no lobby shop, so no luck buying any incidentals you may have forgot to pack. 2. Don't try to call the operator from your room or conference room, it will just keep ringing and nobody will answer. 3. You need an operator to connect you to the front desk, but because of #2 above, you can't ever get there. 4. If your stay needs to be extended, too bad. They don't block off any rooms for that purpose. Very embarrassing when your meetings go over and your business partners have to pack up and find another hotel. 5. Shoddy cleaning of conference rooms overnight. I did not try the restaurants (worked late) so I can not comment.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but strange breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: liveyourlifegood
Reviews.Content: After a terrible flight we took a cab from LAX to the hotel. It is about 30-40 minutes driving if there is no traffic jam. The hotel is located on the Avenue of the Stars next to the Westfield shopping mall with a lot of shops and small fast food restaurants. The hotel has a very nice exterior and big lobby. We checked in at around 11AM with Judy, she was friendly and checked us in but our room wasn’t ready so we had to wait 20 minutes next to the reception. It is weird she didn’t tell anything about our ambassador privileges, breakfast, our room or internet login. There is also no separate ambassador check in. Our room was on the 9th floor not far from the elevators. We were upgraded to a big suite I guess, it was not modern at all but big. It had a separate seating area with sofa, big TV and a desk. Then there was the sleeping room with a big bed and another TV. The bathroom was very big with 2 doors, one to the bed and the other one to the living room. The bathroom had a big bath, shower, toilet and 2 very nice soft bathrobes. We had also 2 terraces adjacent to our room. The room was overall very clean and in the evening we got one small bottle of water and some fruits. The beds were very good and the next day we had breakfast in the main restaurant. I booked a Red Carpet arrangement which included breakfast. We were surprised that Jairo, our waiter gave us a menu card for breakfast but e couldn’t explain us what was and was not included in our room rate with breakfast. We just got the buffet. It is build out of 2 sections. One with hot food and a selection of fruits and salmon, ham , … The other part are the pastries and breads. Overall it was very small and only 1 kind of egg we could choose. They actually forgot to turn on the heat under the eggs. Every other egg we wanted was paid . The quality was very good but the selection was very small. This was a disappointment. At check out we even had to pay for breakfast taxes even when it was included in our fare !! Big disappointment We want to take a cab to the departure station of the hop on / off bus and a very very kind staff member with short hear ( I am sorry but don’t remember the name ) asked if we wanted to use the free house car. Nobody told us there was one but he asked the concierge Stephen but he told : No, to far. So we wasted time but just took a cab. We asked the Concierge Stephen when we had to leave the next day for the Warner Bros studios and he told us 10.20 for tour departure at 11.00 . The head concierge booked it for us but he was nowhere to be seen during our stay. We took a cab and arrived very late at 10.59 and the lady told us we normally had to be there 30 minutes in advance also the concierge booked under my name but it was spelled not correctly. The concierge Stephen was overall not helpful nor friendly. The hotel has a big pool but we did not have time to use it. As we were Ambassador members we got free internet daily ! Otherwise it would be very expensive ! We checked out, again with Judy. Now she was less friendly and at check in I gave my VISA card to guarantee the stay. But on the IC website I booked with my Amex card. Judy forgot to delete one breakfast and even before I could check, she already debited the wrong amount. After asking and arguing she credited the amount ( 56 $ ) back on my American Express card. When I got home I saw on my bank account that Judy debited my Amex for the wrong amount but credited the difference but also charged my VISA card for the wrong amount. She so double charged me !! I couldn’t believe this ! So I called the hotel and again I had Judy on the phone and she was rude and did not let me speak out? When I started a sentence she over talked me all the time and was not friendly and rude. Eventually yesterday my Visa card is credited again. Overall a good stay with mostly friendly staff except some and a good location. But in LA you need to take a taxi or a Hop on / Off bus !

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all!”
Reviews.Author: montyhades
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased by the service, the info, the place, everything just great, from the moment I gave the keys to the valet parking guy to the moment I checked out. The people at the front desk greeted me awesome, and I even got an upgrade to a room with a very nice view to the city. And after a long day visiting around I came to the restaurant and the food was great and the service even better. In all I will say staying here was a great choice. Staying here again in my future visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “great access to LA and Walt Disney Concert Hall”
Reviews.Author: rogerbowman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice to go to concerts at the Walt Disney Concert Hall, which is about a half hour drive away. Impressed both times. Some rooms overlook the backlot of 20th Century Fox, and the first time they were shooting a movie with fake fires and gunfire, which was fun to watch. We kept stumbling into commercials being shot on the streets around the hotel and Beverly Hills. Elegent lobby. Excellent service. Good in house restaurant, which was quick for pre-concert. Not much to walk to from hotel, so a car is recommended ($36/night for parking).

Reviews.Title: “An excellent example of LA service”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Gourand
Reviews.Content: I could not speak more highly about the Intercontinental in Century City. All the staff, from the reception to the sushi chef, were friendly and engaging. The food (room service) was lovely and not overly pricey. There was free coffee served in the bar in the mornings. The rooms were large, beds amazingly comfortable and there was a real sense of luxury about the whole hotel. The Westfield shopping centre was within 5 mins walking distance so you could 'escape' and walk a bit if you wanted to. An excellent stay all round.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lubbus
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome from the staff even though the hotel was very busy with a wedding reception in progress. This hotel is a bit dated but we found it very clean and updated in a few areas. The lobby is impressive as you would expect from an Intercontinental but other areas like the lift and carpet are showing their age. There were a couple of things that we weren't happy about. The bath plug would not fully close and calling for room service around 11pm transferred me through to reception and was told that I would get a call back. After waiting 20 mins I called again and was told the same thing and I finally got the call a further 25mins after the second call. The bed was extremely comfortable and ranks as 1 of the best nights sleep I've ever had. There are good views from high level floors and as with all LA it is best to have a car to get around although this hotel is near the Westfield mall. Call the valet from your room so when you get down your car will be ready. All in all a very nice stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gogirlnyc
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional from arrival to departure. I was very impressed with the professionalism and friendliness of the staff on all levels, with consistency. I found that the location was very good, including a short walk of approx 10 minutes to the Westfield Mall at Century City. There is also a chauffeur driven car available to transport you within a radius of 3 miles, if needed. The room was very comfortable and pristine, including a nice size balcony. The hotel overall is quite beautiful. I will definitely consider this hotel as my first choice when returning to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, but not to normal IC standards...”
Reviews.Author: Stanchion
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at the InterContinental Century City and although there was nothing wrong with the stay, I left feeling I had been short-changed some how. This started with my room not being ready until after 4pm on the day of arrival and the hotel appearing a little dated on first impressions. Once finally in the room (and in fairness a suite upgrade due to my Platinum Priority Club status) this feeling of being underwhelmed continued. The room looked tired and a bit scuffed around the edges. Nothing was complimentary in the room including bottled water. The only thing that took my breath away was the the price of a Snickers ($5!). Service levels followed this pattern of not quite being spot-on e.g the concierge did not seem to be particularly effusive in his assistance and would often disappear from the desk for long periods. This meant I got charged $8 for a local call (to book a restaurant) because I could not locate him by phone or in person! I was also advised I would have to purchase a UK/US power converter rather than borrow one which tends to be the norm in most hotels I visit. Got the feeling the hotel was just a little bit mean. Location is pretty good, about a 10 min walk to the Westfield shopping development and 30 min on foot to Rodeo Drive etc. So in summary nothing really wrong with the hotel, just fails to impress in the way other Intercontinental properties I have visited (Paris, Istanbul, Al Khobar etc) do.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kfoley
Reviews.Content: We were in LA for our niece's graduation from UCLA so we booked this hotel for it's proximity to the campus and decent rate compared to everything else in the area for that weekend. Upon stepping out of our car we felt like royalty. There were staff members everywhere ready and willing to help with whatever we needed. When checking in, the front desk attendant noticed we had our 5 year old daughter with us and upgraded us to a suite for free. She even asked if we wanted somebody to come up and make up the pull out bed for us. Our room was beautiful. A living room with a large flat screen TV, couch, chair, coffee table and desk. There was a balcony with two chairs and a small table. French doors led into the bedroom which included another flat screen TV mounted to the wall and a king bed. The bathroom was spacious with a seperate shower and tub. The room was extremely clean and smelled like a spa! After getting settled we went downstairs to the restaurant for a bite to eat. Everybody was really great with our daughter calling her princess and waiting on her hand and foot. Probably the only down side to our entire stay was the menu. It was extremely expensive and not a lot of choices. We opted for a couple of appetizers to share and our daughter had a kids pizza and our check was over $60 with no alcohol. Everything we had was very good though and the service was great. After dinner we went to the pool. The pool area was very pretty with lots of plam trees and it was very clean. There were cushioned lounge chairs with plenty of towels available. We had to pass by the gym on the way to the pool and we noticed that it looked really big for a hotel gym and it had nice equipment. The pool was heated but still didn't feel very warm on that chilly night. Our daughter didn't mind it, but we ended up sitting in the hot tub instead. A couple of final things, the hotel didn't have any kind of coffee bar or place to grab a quick breakfast or even a place to grab a soda and a snack. I didn't even see any soda machines, not even where the ice was on our floor. It had a gift shop, but everytime we walked past it was closed. There was a Starbucks a couple of blocks down and they did have a courtsey car to take you to places nearby, but that's not too convenient with a 5 year old in tow. Overall it was a great stay at a beautiful hotel. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: scubanow
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights on business. They upgraded me to a suite and the accomodations were absolutely lovely and very spacious. There was also a small balcony with a nice view. It was very pleasant to sit out there with my morning coffee. The hotel staff are extrememely frindly and accommodating. The hotel provides a car and driver for destinations with a few mile radius. This worked well for me because most of my meetings were just a couple of miles away. Because of this service, I didn't have to rent a car! The food at the hotel is excellent, particularly the Japanese breakfast from room service and the sushi in the main restaurant. The fitness center is small but has everything you need. There is a nice pool but I never saw anyone using it. I also got a very nice manicure from the spa. The spa is rather small and didn't seem very busy. All in all, a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, but over the top”
Reviews.Author: UALsandiego
Reviews.Content: The place looks impressive. Huge entrance hall and marble/granite everywhere. When I checked in, they were overbooked and forced me to upgrade for $50/night to a larger room. No compromise. Concierge sort of rude. Valet parking $36/night. They still took almost 20min to get the car out of the garage. Snickers bar in room: $5 Borrow a DVD player: $25 Internet: $13 Nice spa area with sauna, steam room, and outdoor pool. Since I got a suite, I'd have expected a bit more. Yes, we had 2 flat screen TVs, but the wallpaper was a bit 1990s, and so was the carpet. VERY nice bathroom though, with light granite everywhere. Excellent housekeeping and support staff for sure. Mall and bus withing walking distance. Bus will take you to Beverly Hills, West Hollywood. Alternative parking available during the week. It's a good hotel, but the pricing is just not appropriate for the way they will still rip you off once you're there.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star experience !!”
Reviews.Author: Musclebearnz
Reviews.Content: What can I say; anything less than 5 stars just wouldnt be fair. I stayed the last weekend in May and as a Platinum Ambassador member, I was upgraded to a lovely suite overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The staff were all consistent in their level of impeccable service and respect without that stuffiness, sometimes apparant in 4-5 star hotels. It would be unfair to pick out one exemplary staff member as everyone was exemplary from the time I arrived to when I finally departed. The Valet service for my car was always speedy. The room and its furnishings were top notch. The bed was one to die for, I even checked what brand the bed and the topper were as I want the same for home. Well done IC-CC, I will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Top 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Living4theweekend88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Centrally located to all the attractions that entice you in a big city. Got a great deal on Travelocity which surprised the upscale guests that were greeted alongside plain ole me! We had a blast pulling up in our Toyota next to Mercedes and Lexus's. Please try the grapefruit martini - put me to sleep comfortably each night!

Reviews.Title: “In one word - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JCity74
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and some delightful staff who are genuine and kind. Some staff probably need to be reminded that they have a job there as opposed to own the place but this is a handful. Excellent quality food, great variety and probably best hotel food I have eaten worldwide. Great size rooms, but they are in need of refurbishment. Walking distance to Rodeo Dr - excellent open air mall Westfield 10min walk. Open air tourist bus stops at front door. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! The best value and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Nav1987
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience ranging from the customer service of staff to the rooms! Rooms were dirty and ripped sheets, stains on walls and floors..rip off parking charges an wifi charges..staff were rude and unpleasant totally ruined my stay and will NEVER stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: Rather-B-travelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location within LA. Close to Beverly Hills homes which make for a nice walk from the hotel to the Rodeo Drive area. The lobby, restaurant and bar area is a great place to relax and is very well appointed. My room (chose the superior double room) was a litle tired and could do with an upgrade soon. However it was comfortable and had all the amenities you need with a good size bathroom. The only negative point here is that they use in-room air conditioning systems which can be noisy at times. A chauffeured Mercedes is available for guests free of charge for trips within approx 4km from the hotel, which is a really nice touch. All the staff where very pleasant, helpful and accomodating. It is true that there is not a lot of nightlife out your door, but the Sunset strip is only around a 10min taxi ride. All in all, I enjoyed staying at the IC and would reccomend it to other visitors to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific option in LA - luxuious, clean and very well run”
Reviews.Author: Jordan_Silber
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights as a family of four with two toddlers. A very nice city hotel, extremely convenient to local attractions. Century City is such a nice place to base. The nearby mall has everything. The staff were very wonderful to us, from excellent pre-arrival support to a terrific bellman (great restaurant recommendations), all around good. The rooms and hotel facilities are very well kept up. We enjoyed the pool terrace, a nice comfortable and quiet place to lay out and take a swim or jump in the hot tub. Breakfast food was high quality, service could be sped up a little but nothing too bad. Overall probably the best place we have stayed in the LA area recently. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey and inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: grizz9
Reviews.Content: This is, I suppose, an upscale hotel and the rooms are clean and large. It is in an area that is solely hotels and office buildings. Other than the hotel, there are no restaurants, shopping, bars, etc. to walk to. The bed had only a bottom sheet and heavy comforter and it was impossible to get a comfortable temperature for sleeping. The heater/air conditioning unit was exceptionally loud so the choice was to swelter under the thick comforter or to not sleep due to the noise. It was a non-smoking room, but there was an ashtray on the table out on the small patio outside the room. They charge a lot for the rooms, and then charge $36 for parking and charge for internet. There is a mini bar in the room with ridiculous prices such as a small bottle of water for $5.50 or a 1/2 bottle of wine for $24. They said that morning coffee was complimentary, but there was a sign by the coffee saying $2. I am sure this is fine for business travelers with good expense accounts, but not for vacationers, families, or others.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: Stuart096
Reviews.Content: Not what I expected from an Intercontinental. The parking is both expensive and annoying - impolite and unfriendly staff. Internet is charged per device per room; I have a laptop and a WIFI phone and I had to pay twice !! I am a platinum Priority Club member and I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DogWorld
Reviews.Content: The valet staff was great - very quick and polite. The hotel is upscale and well tended to. The cleaning staff is very efficient and almost invisible - never in our way. Food is very good and the dining room staff very attentive without being intrusive. The concierage staff was OK - the one weakness to the hotel. They were a little snooty and, while helpful, they didn't really go out of their way to offer great service. For example, we booked a city tour our first day - despite checking three times and specifically asking, with different concierage staff, they never told us to wait at the end of the hotel driveway. And they were not very forward-leaning in offering suggestions so we simply went with our Fodor's guide book. The location on the Fox backlot was great - and the American Idol cast (final seven) was at our hotel. Lots of fun. All in all, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: 316066Rubio
Reviews.Content: We can confidently say that intercontinental Los Angeles is the best hotel we have visited in recent years because the rooms are extraordinary and they provided us with the unusual comfort that you never expect from a hotel. The shower was great and powerful and the quality of sheets and bedding superb and very soft. Quality of sleep was excellent and we never heard the next door people and that is something I always fear when I stay in a hotel. We highly rate this hotel and it is a great place indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Parking is Extremely expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hanna M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. Room were clean but little outdated. This is older hotel. Parking was extremely expensive. There are no alterntives in the neighborhood so the management takes advantage. I book it on Priceline at $120, which was just about rigth price. No free Internet anywhere in the hotel . Restaurant is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LAK1113
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontiental for 2 nights while visiting LA. 1st off this hotel is in a excellent location. Right next store to the FOX studios and a short drive to LAX. Also for the shoppers out there, a shopping mall within walking distance. Easy excess to Beverly Hills, Hollywood and Santa Monica. The hotel entrance and lobby is very beautiful. Trendy with fresh flowers everywhere! The staff was excellent!!! Every single staff memeber from the valet, front desk, bellman, room service, housekeeping, restuarant and bar staff were all friendly and happy and always asking how our stay was going. The room was very nice with windows and balcony that wrapped around. The spa was nice and the staff member were friendly and educated. I recommend getting a massage if you stay at hotel. I am a frequent spa goer and I definitely rank this massage up there. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend to anyone looking for a very nice hotel, in super location that is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2010_10
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very helpful and quick. My stay occurred during a very unpleasant wind and rain storm and the staff made every effort to keep the guests dry and warm while waiting for cars to be brought around and taxi's to be pulled forward. The rooms could use a facelift. I am sure that the hotel has not seen a major renovation since it was still a Park Hyatt. It's starting to show it's age. I had several nice patio’s but only one of the sliding doors could be used as furniture was squeezed into the room in ways that didn't fit right. I am not fond of having the bathroom sink actually IN the bedroom and not in the bathroom behind the door. The bar was a nice spot for an evening drink. Live music one night I was there. The mall down the road has a couple of good places to eat and Beverly Hills is a quick drive. Restaurant row on La Cienega is also close. Try the Stinking Rose. It's pretty good food and good for a laugh. But I love garlic.... Free Mercedes to the mall as well, not a bad deal, saves the cab fare. All told, a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the standard”
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my family and would highly recommend the Intercontinental to anyone staying in the Century City area. Service was top-notch from the valet on arrival to the desk staff at checkout. We took advantage of the complimentary car and driver ( a beautiful Mercedes) to enjoy dinner at nearby Westfield Shopping Center. The room and view from balcony was also well appointed and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slikstr
Reviews.Content: Pros: -impeccable Service -comfortable beds -Free Wifi (I'm an Ambassador member) -Hotel has Driver in a Mercedes that will drop you off and pick you up within 1.5 miles of the Hotel -15 minute drive to Universal Studios -20 minute drive to Santa Monica Beach and Pier -20 minute drive to LAX -ate Dinner in Hotel Restaurant, very good food -Valet Parking was extremely quick -Hotel located in upscale business area, felt very safe and secure -outdoor Pool and Hot Tub located on second Floor were very clean, heated pool was warm -very good SPA -late checkout with no hassles CONS: -very hard for me to come up with a CON for this property. I am a Platinum Member with both Priority Rewards and Marriott so have stayed in a lot of different Hotels. This was one of the nicest properties I have ever stayed in. -no Executive Lounge (very surprising since this Hotel is located in a Business district) -For me it wasn't an issue, but some people may have an issue with the fact that Valet parking is the only option($35/day), and that there is nothing in walking distance from this Hotel TIPS: -California Pizza Kitchen is about a 5 minute drive (they also deliver to the Hotel, $6 + tip delivery fee), great food at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you love great service”
Reviews.Author: daniels86
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic. If your at the restaurant inside ask for Terry to be your waiter! An absolute champion. Also I had a light flu type symptoms they had their curtousy mercedes car with driver take me to a local pharmacy and waited for me!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay! Staff---amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ohana40
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel, from the moment we arrived the staff was simply amazing! I have stayed in many hotels in many different price points--this exceeded all expectations. I took my 20yr. old daughter for 'mother/daughter' trip to LA. We were lucky enough to upgrade to stay in a suite--better than any suite I've ever stayed in. We had a friend staying at the hotel -she had standard room which was great--I would have been perfectly fine in that room as well. We took advantage of the courtesy house car which will take you within 1 1/2 miles of the hotel--got us to area malls, restaurants and to "window shop" in Beverly Hills. I liked that the hotel was in Century City-kind of tucked away from everything-felt more relaxed. We enjoyed the restaurant but the menu was somewhat limited. I must admit, after running around all day we ended up eating at the hotel most nights--due to our own laziness--didn't want to venture out after a long day. If you like sushi--it looked fabulous and was enjoyed by many in the lounge area. Looked like a great place for happy hour after work...and you must try the Parmesan French Fries--to die for! The only major knock against the hotel was that you had to pay for wi-fi --for each device in room-with what we were paying-that seemed somewhat excessive. I know other chains charge for it as well and I put the same complaint on their reviews as well. I also know others had complained about the parking charges if you had a rental; I read that and opted to use the courtesy car-it was perfect for what we needed but realize that may not be the case for everyone. Honestly though, most hotels charge for parking regardless of what city you are in these days. Overall and the reason I highly recommend this hotel was the staff..they went above and beyond their jobs on a daily basis. Customer Service is my main priority and from the moment we arrived--from the Bellman, Front Desk staff, Courtesy car drivers, wait staff --all were extraordinary! Luis-the Concierge--phenominal job--made the entire experience that much better! They all made you feel at ease and no one was in the least bit snobbish--can't say that about a few places we visited in the area. In the Service industry these days, it sometimes is difficult to get a staff all on the same page--working for the customer---other hotels would be wise to pay a visit here and learn how it's done-- the correct way!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: ldf1973
Reviews.Content: Great location! The room was sparkling clean and had a great balcony with views of the ocean in the distance. The service could not have been better. Loved the complimentary town car service. The only negative was the price of the Valet Parking. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: wanderkitty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with easy access to the beach, freeway and Hollywood sites. Great shopping any way you turn. The hotel is beautiful. The staff is fantastic. We stayed in room 429 with a patio that looked out on the mountains, the Hollywood sign, and downtown LA. The room service, valet, and housekeeping were all top notch. Loved having a Kuerig brewer for early coffee. A quibbling detail is that the concierge lacked a little in that they had no knowledge of a vegetarian friendly restaurant between there and the beach. Not a problem though because the stay was so great we hated to leave and go back to our real lives.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fantastic service..pricey valet parking”
Reviews.Author: cverduchi
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here and the hotel was clean, the staff was amazing. Room service was fast, accurate, and just overall wonderful. Front desk and concierge- super helpful. Was able to print out directions at a computer at the front desk as a courtesy. Valet service- fast however, the price is a bit much. $36 per day? Really? For a hotel that's not exactly near the heart of Hollywood? I paid $10 to park all day right near Hollywood & Highland. That being said- overall we were very pleased with our stay, the cleanliness, and especially the service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Century City Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was great for me as a business stay. Rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. Unlike most other hotels in LA you couldn't hear your neighbor in the next room which is nice. I do like the fact that they have separate showers and bathtubs. The house car was always convenient going to and from the office down the street. All the staff were very nice and most called me by name, which doesn't happen very often at hotels anymore. The only downside to staying here is the lack of restaurants in Century City but it's only a 5 minute drive and there are plenty. There is also a Ralphs down the street which was nice for getting some soda and snacks on the cheap. You pay for parking just like everywhere else, $36 per day. You do have to pay for internet which is hit or miss with most hotels in LA. It was $12.95 per day here. Overall I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value via Priceline”
Reviews.Author: jwh86
Reviews.Content: Great place given we paid less than half the websites rate buy naming our price on trip adviser. Only thing was its int century city not Beverly hills as priceline said. Room was huge service excellent. Except concierge told us nearest mall was beverly centre 3 miles away when really there is one 400yards away. Otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value luxury hotel close to Beverly Hills and Universal”
Reviews.Author: rcm2140
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Century City was a convenient place to stay on my family's vacation to Southern California. It was a quiet property since it caters mostly to business travelers working in the local entertainment industry (it's literally next door to 20th Century Fox Studios). There's complimentary town car service to nearby attractions (Rodeo Dr., Beverly Hills, etc.). The valet parking is convenient, but overpriced. It's also a half hour drive to Universal Studios to the east and the beaches to the west. The rooms are very comfortable and have great views from private balconies. It's what you expect from Intercontinental. The price is also great - comparable to a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Seanmage
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated for business in Century City as well as easy access to Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive and Westfield Mall. The staff are excellent and the availability of a complimentary luxury Mercedes to drop one off and do a pick-up within a 2 mile radius is perfect. It was easy and comfortable to walk to Westfield mall where there is a wide selection of restaurants, movies, shops etc. a plus for a business traveler needing some down time and a better selection than available in the usual strip mall.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early December for a meeting at UCLA. The hotel is in a quiet part of L.A. (if this exists)--in Century City on the Westside, As an Ambassador member-- I was upgraded to a suite on the 17th floor--very elegant and stylish! Service was outstanding throughout. The restaurant was excellent with friendly and helpful staff. I have been to Southern California on multiple occasions and have stayed in many hotels. This is one of the best, and I look forward to stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: NickB1979
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i stayed in during a recent visit to the USA. Check in staff very polite and efficient and Bell very helpful without being overbearing like some. Very personal service by all and outstanding concierges. Spacious roome with nice views and lovely bathrooms. Get a room with sundeck, preferably east-facing. Don't worry about price of water - go just up the road to Westfield (get a lift in the house car!) and buy from there. Good restaurants and shopping there too. Plenty of room in the in-room fridges. If there were any complaints, and they should NOT be considered if you are thinking of staying here: - Not a great menu at restaurant - Location means cabs to Hollywood, downtown, theme parks, etc are a little expensive if you don't have a car. Use tours booked by concierge as much as possible to save some $$$. However, this means it is in a nice quiet spot if you won't be away from the hustle and bustle and is a little closer to LAX and beaches then most.

Reviews.Title: “great bathroom nice bed good location”
Reviews.Author: flyme2themoonviart66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and had a good stay. The foyer is amazing, the bathroom is spacious, the bed is great, the room is a little dated but very clean. The valet parking seems excessive after paying a good price for the room but after staying in a few places, that's typical LA - get used to it. The pool, spa, steam and sauna are great. The location is central if you want to experience Hollywood and Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: GinnyGuy
Reviews.Content: Yes, Century City is a monstous wasteland (despite the mall), especially at night, when it is just a cavern with empty office buildings. But I knew that going in. The Intercontinental tries to be high-end offering, but falls short. From not having my information at check-in to a welcome "gift" of fruit that had previously been used as garnish on the sushi bar in the lobby (sushi and smell still attached!) to car service that, without notice, stops running as promised, there are too many minuses. We asked to have our bed linens changed; never happened. We asked for wash cloths--ANY wash cloths, since the room cleaner AND turn down attendant both failed to leave any; never got any. Nice, if typically overpriced breakfast, but that's not enough. It's elsewhere for us next month when we go back to L.A>

Reviews.Title: “Meh....”
Reviews.Author: kartwoman
Reviews.Content: I've been on a whirlwind tour for business across the US and have stayed at some great spots. This one wasn't so hot. Front desk guys were very friendly but carpet, bed duvet, and bathroom walls were dirty - yuck. Room is average. Room service food just okay. Expensive forced valet. Fitness room was pretty good. I really object to my Home/Menu page of the TV system having a default setting of scantily clad women reminding me (in lusty voice, naturally) that my hotel bill won't reflect porn charges. Really? That's my greeting? Good thing the kids aren't here with me! Yuck again. Wish I could be more positive, but what is it with L.A.? There must be somewhere fabulous to stay. This is not it. Needed to be in Century City and this was supposedly better than the Hyatt. Hmmmm.....

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonRick
Reviews.Content: When looking at hotels in LA they all seemed very expensive including this one, however we got a good deal on their website for 4 nights in a junior suite including breakfast. ON arrival we were greeted by the valet and doorman, and taken to check in, all were extremely friendly and genuine. The check in process was simple and we were shown to our room. The room was a great size and I'm glad we upgraded, it had all the amenities you would expect from a hotel of this standard. I still object to paying for wireless, something which is all to common with ICH group hotels and I really think they need to stop charging for it. Cleanliness and comfort of the room were fantastic, my only criticism and I'm being picky here, is that the decor was well worn in places. Torn wall paper on low corners in the room and slightly dowdy looking curtains did mar the otherwise warm and modern feel of the room. Breakfast was excellent, expensive if you didnt have it included. Staff here were great, one chap was a little bizarre, friendly but over familiar and kept telling us about his other jobs (comedian I think he said) and his travel, and gave us his business card. This I found off putting, but as I say food was great and service matched this. Overall hotel staff were great, the concierge was amazing and helped us with restaurant bookings and activities. Again if I had a criticism it would be that the front desk staff could be a little cold, at one point I felt I had to apologise in asking for their help. The hotel itself is lovely, very nicely designed and we really did enjoy our stay here. The pool and gym area were great. It does feel a bit "removed" from LA due to its surroundings and you definitely need a car if you stay here but I would highly recommend this hotel. It was actually quite nice to come back to after a day in crazy LA! The quiet relaxed feel of the place helped to make us feel very comfortable and welcome. They have a car service which was brilliant and we used this to take us into Beverly Hills for dinner a couple of times. Good points, great hotel, lovely mordern decor, overall friendly staff-nothing was too much trouble. Bad points, extra costs like wireless and the extorntionate valet parking charge! BE AWARE ITS $35 A DAY!!!! You cannot park your own car and this wasn't mentioned on the ICH website, if I had known this I may not have booked as I felt paying an extra $140 plus tips everytime you needed the car was a step too far! Overall a great stay slightly marred by the hidden charges but if you can get past those then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldMoscower
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my family in October for 3 nights. Excelent hotel, the only minus is the price)). Typically, I have critical approach, however was not able to find anything to blame hotel or its staff. The staff was very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but extra costs were annoying considering the nightly rate”
Reviews.Author: wilki00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted something nice but affordable for our anniversary trip. This hotel was overall nice and it was in a great location. However, there were some fees that we weren't aware of when we booked, such as the valet parking for over $30 a day. That adds up when you stay for a week. And there were no other options, so you pretty much have to pay it. I couldn't believe you even had to pay for wireless. For such a nice hotel, you'd think that would be included...i mean you can even get free wireless at smaller/less attractive motels. The prices of the food and drinks were also outrageous. Definitely smarter to plan on eating out and not at the hotel if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: racy975
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this place at all. We have stayed in IC hotels in a few places, but this was a lovely oasis from the busy streets of LA outside and the service was as you would expect. The room was clean, spacious and the bed and pillows amazingly comfortable. The Spa was gorgeous too. All in all, would definitely return here if we were to stay in Beverly Hills again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RuralMA
Reviews.Content: Normally I stay at the Century Plaza down the street, but they were booked so I ended up here - rooms were much more updated, service was great and the price was much more reasonable - only downside was the in-hotel dining option, which was more limited. Staff were very friendly, top to bottom, entryway was very inviting. Balcony on the room was very nice compared to my usual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ashish007
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my family and we took 3 rooms. All the rooms were very spacious and clean. Service was also very good. As soon as we checked in, we had our hotel host come and give us some handy details or how to go around the hotel and LA. He also told us to go and shop for water, chips etc from the super market nearby since it would be cheaper ( not many do that ). The best part of the hotel was its location. Very centrally located. Rodeo Drive was barely a mile away. 5- 7 MINS walk from a really good mall called Westfield. Another really nice thing about the hotel was its hotel car. It was a S550! and would drop and pick us up anywhere upto 2 miles from the hotel. Beverly Hills, century city all fell in this range. Food was ok but expensive. But not to worry the mall had an amazing food court and for our indian friends theres this indian restaurant called Nizaam which served really good indian food.

Reviews.Title: “It just takes one employee made an important good difference”
Reviews.Author: GreginSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: Ordinarily, Century City hotels aren't usually where our family would stay, but a voucher was about to expire and the Intercont'l was our choice and the hotel exceeded expectations. +'s and -'s of the Intercontinental Hotel: * Traveling with a 93 year old Mom has its joys and challenges. Certainly the maitre d at breakfast by taking a few minutes of his time to small talk with Mom - what a big difference that made in our stay. Thank you; thank you. *In room dining was very good, if a bit expensive. There's a delivery fee and mandated 21% gratuity. Mom had never done this before - circling thumb and forefinger with a kiss of excellence. *Free (good) coffee in the lobby area. The pastries and service were an unexpectedly good quality also. The coffee bar area employees were knowledgeable and attentive. *Although we're not smokers, one of our guests was and having a balcony with chairs and ash tray - that's a nice touch one doesn't find in many hotels these days. *My uprgrade was to a suite - sure was nice. Unfortunately front desk didn't note Mom in a walker to provide a room where one could maneuver through desk and wall to enter the main part of the room. *One feels a classy ambience here. *Free town car transport within 1.5 miles. *Hotel rates are good considering four star hotels can cost as much or more. *Pool area was fine - quiet, nice towels, decent prices on menu, pretty enough views. Gardens were maintained well. Now the -'s: Lots of nice flowers in the lobby - but maybe more of an impression could be made if there were fewer but more artfully arranged bouquets. (Picky - but noticeable.) Lots of arrangements but one day they looked tired, until replaced on Sunday. Parking is a bit pricey, but service is efficient. Only valet is available and there are no/few options closeby. Hotel is showing a bit of age - didn't bother me. On the TV evaluation I made several commendations and have no idea if management received the review. It seems as if management should be more on top of such matters, but yes, we're all overworked and underpaid. It's usually easy for me to observe flaws and strong points in a hotel - can't really find much to carp here. The Century City Intercontinental is worth considering for an LA stay.

Reviews.Title: “hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: We booked this with Hotwire, and didn't we know it! First room was tiny and over the boiler room. They kindly moved us to another room which was OK but definitely NOT 4 star. Small and dingy, quite unlike the lovely public areas. We reluctantly paid for Wi-Fi so that we could contact our children, but were informed that if we both wanted to use it ono our iPhones we would have to pay twice. I have never heard of this before and was not at all happy. They did agree to waive the second charge, but needless to say it was on the bill! Reception staff reluctant to strike up any kind of rapport. Moved out to Hotel Palomar which was absolutely fantastic - slightly more expensive, but were upgraded to Presidential Suite - see review.

Reviews.Title: “Increase the range please!”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: I keep coming back to this cosy hotel in Century City ever since its opening as a Marriott Hotel, and then its change of management to the Hyatt, then finally the Intercontinental. I do recommend their in-house Mercedes S550 for complimentary rides (both ways) in the vicinity, However I suggest that they increase the range of drop-offs/pick-ups from 1.5 miles to at least 4 miles like other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars location, 3 stars amenities”
Reviews.Author: pkong13141
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there this weekend. Elegant Floral arrangement all over the lobby was great in dark purple. The location is very convenience for Hollywood, Beverly Hill, Griffith park and etc. We had the double bed room in 11th floor. The view was awesome from the balcony. The bed is full size not queen. The shower was not running consistence water temperature. It was 1 sec.burning hot and another sec. freezing cold.I report the issue to the front desk the other day;however, the technician thought there was no hot water.I told him again it was the temperature not consistence running in one shower.He couldn't fix the problem.They moved us to the lower floor suite for the second night. Then we found out they gave us the smoking room and then this time the A/C kept running when I set it in "auto mode" with "75F"!! After I went back and forth trying to settle down the noise, I just turn it off and then we found out that was the smoking room.The parking fee is ridiculous expensive which could pay for the motel room. It is $36 daily. No Wifi nor internet access unless you pay another $12 daily. There is no "business center" provided at all in the hotel. The pool in 2nd floor is relatively small. There are 2 showers and one steam room and one sauna room is free for use. We stayed in Scottsdale,AZ location this year Feb. where the facilities is much better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place- Nice and Friendly but way over priced.”
Reviews.Author: goodtobemad
Reviews.Content: My mom and I came to Los Angeles for celebrity hunting and a great time. The intercontinental offered just that. The taxi drivers, the restaurant staff and the maids were very friendly. We spent $477 just at the hotel. That was for our meals and 1 movie. I would recommend this to people who are wealthy or enjoy spending money. But other then that- it was an amazing trip. It's in the middle of no where which means no noise. My advice -don't get room service. 21% added charge

Reviews.Title: “good hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: travelingtills
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week with the family while visiting LA. The staff was always very helpful and friendly. Room was clean and comfortable. A mall is nearby and the hotel will shuttle you over and back in their S500 which is nice. It's easy to get to Beverly Hills, Hollywood and Santa Monica all from this location and the traffic isn't bad. It was a solid hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel with a good location!”
Reviews.Author: VegasHotel80
Reviews.Content: I used priceline for a hotel in the Beverly hills/west hollywood area and ended up staying here for a little more than half off the prevailing rate. The hotel is in a good location, not too far from anything. Parking was 36 dollars a night but we were prepared for it. It is also valet only but they were fast in retrieving the car. All the employees we encountered were very helpful and polite. The room was of good size and had two double beds and a small balcony. The bathroom was nice with a seperate tub and shower. Had no complains about the room. The gym is nice and the pool/spa area was a good place to relax. They also have seperate mens and womens locker rooms with a sauna and steam room. I would recommend this hotel since it has a good location and the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: meg329
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice lobby, friendly staff! Gave us an upgrade without us even having to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Average - some good points and bad ones too.”
Reviews.Author: cdngrrleh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is "just OK". I liked my room well enough, but found the decor old. It needs to be updated to be modern, hip, and fresh. The pool is nice but as the weather was cold, not really usable. They should turn up the temperature to make it more comfortable. Also, I did not see any attendants around to serve food/drink by the pool - disappointing. Staff were great - concierge, room service, spa, front line staff were all very helpful. Almost over eager at times! :) I got a *great* price for my room by booking through their web site but found myself checking out with a big fat bill. It costs more than $30 a day to park your car there. This is ridiculous! Parking should be included. Wireless is another $14 per day. In today's high-tech world, good hotels should offer complimentary wireless. Lastly, I made a call to Laguna about a tour and it cost me $9 for talking less than 2 mins. I booked a room with a sun deck. The sun deck was great - however it could only be accessed by passing through a narrow passage. I'm not that big and I had to go sideways through the opening to reach the other side. Anyone who is large would not even be able to reach the sun deck at all. This is very bad! The room was clean although the bathtub was filthy! It was like someone had dumped sand in the tub. I requested the concierge send someone up to take care of it immediately (which they did). The spa was awesome and I would go there again. Services were excellent and the staff did a great job. Food in the resto was good, but also way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Scapa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many American hotels but this is probably the best. This a very short review because there was nothing much to complain about!! Great location especially as "Die Hard 1" was on the TV the first night we were there and our balcony looked out over the "Nakatomi Towers". Brilliant for move loving sons!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very nice; front desk personnel did not present accurate information when I voiced a valid complaint.”
Reviews.Author: fdonoghue
Reviews.Content: Traveling with children (ages 5,7 and 13) for a one night stay for a family wedding. Was given a Handicap room and immediately requested a change for a room with a bathtub so that the girls could take a bubble bath. The clerk, or front desk manager, replied that all the rooms in the hotel were showers only and none had bathtubs. However, in conversation with Housekeeping Manager, I found out that there were, in fact, rooms with bathtubs. There may not have been any available at the time, but there was no reason for the clerk to flat-out lie to me. The maitre de was very good when we had lunch in the hotel, polite and accommodating. The driver who took us to the nearest store was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant - for leisure and business, we'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wonworld
Reviews.Content: My husband had a meeting at the nearby Hyatt, but based on Trip Advisor reviews I chose this hotel for our family to tag along with him, and it turned out to be a great choice. My husband had stayed at the Hyatt previously, so he confirmed a few great wins: breakfast buffet here was much better, free in-house 24-hr health club was terrific (vs paying and having to go off-site). For business, he got reimbursed for the wi-fi fee, but wouldn't have been reimbursed for a health club fee. The people who worked here were very friendly, and smilingly enjoyed the company of our son who parked himself in the lobby during the world cup soccer games. A sleek Mercedes with a dark-suited driver drove us to and from several destinations within a limited radius - including the Museum of Tolerance, Rodeo Drive, and the Westfield Mall, where we stocked up on water and the like for our room. Dinner at their restaurant was high quality. We constantly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “my third visit... always wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: RobertInExile
Reviews.Content: we just spent another great week at the intercontinental los angeles in century city, and are glad we decided to repeat with this property. i'll go back as often as i can. room service is terrific on food and timely delivery, the entire staff is helpful, pleasant (unlike some places in nearby beverly hills) and accommodating, all services are exactly as they should be, and because this is a fairly large hotel, you can often get exceptional deals and packages through online travel sites, as we did. under $150 per night including a luxe car? yes! we had a standard room that showed a little bit of wear, but having stayed in deluxe rooms there before (they're beautiful), this was small penance. great location for shopping, dining and more. go and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: oranges8
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed to find that this particular Intercontinental has such poor service. When we called for a shower cap, condiments for the coffee/tea, room slippers and body lotion, we were shocked the only request which was correct were the room slippers.We told the guest services to leave the items in the room as it was late when we arrived and were going to the hotel restaurant for dinner. When we called again upon returning from dinner, we had to wait more than 30 minutes and it took 2 persons to come with the other items. The next day, the housekeeping did not leave any coffee/tea condiments and we had to request for them.The guest services called the room 3 times to find out whether it was delivered.They do not seem to understand you do not call the guest and you need to find out from your own staff.It took them 45 minutes to deliver a couple of boxes of condiments. We have stayed in many Intercontinental Hotels and I would say the service in this particular hotel is poor.It was very quiet being the long weekend and yet, they cannot get anything right.Nothing much around the area except for the mall which is a 10 minute walk.The drapes were torn and and the A/C was very, very noisy.The lobby looks nice with orchids but the room is kind of old.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: Polly8140
Reviews.Content: We did a tour of LA and Vegas as part of our honeymoon. This hotel was our first stop. It was wonderful in every way! Parking was slightly on the pricey side, but they had your car ready within 2 minutes of calling for it, so well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: BKKandKSK
Reviews.Content: Just back from a business meeting at the Los Angeles/Century City InterContinental. I enjoyed the meeting but really loved the service quality of the hotel. A few caveats: I didn't pay for ANYTHING on the trip--the hosting organization did. In fact, I have not idea what they paid so this is a completely price blind review.
