I have been in this hotel years ago when my dear friend was married there. (I think it was a Hyatt brand then.) I recently stayed at the Century Plaza (just down the street) and can use this for a local comparison. The good: The service was beyond amazing. Every person in the hotel (the valet, the doorman, the front desk, the servers at the meeting rooms, and the bartenders) made me feel incredibly welcomed. Nothing (NOTHING) was left to chance. I arrived a bit late the first day for my meeting and the valet was extremely sensitive to this. He made sure that I knew exactly where I needed to be in the hotel (and would have walked me there if I needed help). The front desk made sure that my frequent stayer credit got to my account. Normally, this is not big deal, but since I didn't pay for the room, I was particularly impressed that they did this. The servers and bartenders at our meeting were beyond amazing. Without asking, the servers noted what I was drinking and made sure that my glasses were never empty--even making sure that whatever I wanted could be brought in from the outside bar. Small touch, but great service!! The final point was that there was some minor confusion about parking for the meeting. On two days, I asked a hotel employee to clarify small details for me. On both occasions, they immediately found a manager and immediately addressed the issue. I didn't have to ask for for special treatment--they just immediately took care of my concerns. The location of the hotel is great--easy walk to a wide variety of places to eat and drink if you don't have a car...can't imagine that you would be in LA without a car though... The bad... The grounds are not as lovely as the Century Plaza. The pool was ok...not much has changed since my friend got married there a few years ago despite the change in hotel branding. The ugly... Ain't nothing ugly here...

Reviews.Title: “Photos don't do this hotel justice. Great hotel staffed by great people.”
Reviews.Author: campfiar
Reviews.Content: I felt like a VIP from the moment my cab dropped me off. Everyone here has passed customer service school with flying colors. My room was meticulously detailed and gave me the feeling I was the first person sleeping in it. I had a great view of the Hollywood sign from the patio. Would I stay here again? The question should be, "Would I stay anywhere else if I return to LA?" My answer to the latter question would be - wouldn't even consider another hotel. About me: I stay in 8-10 hotels of varying quality per year for combined leisure and business pursuits. This hotel is the finest I've stayed at in the US.

Reviews.Title: “For the price - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BusTrav106
Reviews.Content: I took this vacation as a splurge before starting a new job - and all in all - I expected a lot more. The room was ok, not great - I specifically asked for a sundeck which was almost impossible to get to with a huge pillar in the way. The comments about looking for tips was spot on but what can you expect. Most of the staff were nice - the hotel restaurant had very nice staff, but the prices (even for LA) were ridiculous. There really is not much around the hotel - other than the mall. I have to say at the end of the trip when I looked at the bill - I felt cheated. And I travel a lot. Disappointing. Definitely would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Booked on Hotwire/Great deal”
Reviews.Author: treenie12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Hotwire and got it for $112/night. That is why i can check that it was a good value. It would have been 2 or 3x that otherwise. Our room was excellent, with a great eastward view with beautiful sunrises each morning we were there (3). We only ate one meal in the hotel, breakfast, and it was excellent, also. I really liked the bathroom in our room, although 2 sinks would have been preferable. It had a separate shower, tub, and nice sink with marble vanity(or granite, not sure) but very pretty. The room was very clean, the bed comfortable, and it was quiet. Not really any privacy when on the balcony, but that was no problem for us as we didn't use the balcony much, except to take a few pictures of the sunrise. We were there to watch our daughter-in-law run the LA marathon, and it was a very easy walk to see her and all the other runners go by. I was disappointed that the hotel does not have a gift shop anymore, as i really like just browsing sometimes. The outdoor pool was very pretty, although we did not use it, it did look inviting. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location but staffs only want your tips.”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: upgraded to a suite with great view. easy 10mins wlak to Westfield, Fox is only behind the hotel. Once we entered the room within 30 minutes, differnt staffs came in for, our luggages, fruit plate, chocolate plate, water, sacel, sahampoo etc... they kept coming in might be after our tips. We booked a tour with the hotel, but would never agin. the bus has no seatbelt, driver was driving like F1 and over the speed limit. on the way back. He also took a couple to an unschdule stop and laft us in the bus. Compplaned to the lady at the hotel with nothing done. checking out quick. when our limo came the manger told one of the bell boy to pick up our luggage but he went to other guy and park his car for him. I later asked confrontedhim and told the manger to sack him. Everyone pay for the service so they should never only serve people with morw tips!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with gracious staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine35Brookline
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to LA because the package price we got was too good to pass up. Unfortunately, we arrived in the middle of a rare rain storm -- but the hotel more than made up for the gray skies. Immediately upon arrival, we were greeted with a beautiful, tasteful lobby, and the receptionists were genuinely friendly and quick. An employee whisked us up to our room on the 14th floor, all the while filling what is usually very awkward elevator time with easy banter. We needed a wheelchair accessible room, and we were very pleasantly surprised to be ushered into a suite with a living room area, a desk, a separate bedroom, and a bathroom with a roll-in shower (and TWO shower heads). On occasion, we have found hotels that only put accessible rooms on lower floors, but our suite was on the top floor, with sweeping views of the Los Angeles skyline. We were there for three mornings, and each day it became progressively sunnier; each night there were twinkling city lights beneath us. The spa was pretty and quiet -- my boyfriend's massage was so relaxing that he fell asleep on the table. Mine was more of a deep tissue massage, which left me slightly sore the next day. The massage therapist also did my eyebrow wax, which I found to be unsatisfactory. I would recommend going to the brow shaping place at the nearby Westfield mall, instead. On our last evening, we cozied up on one of the aubergine colored velvet couches in the lobby for a glass of wine and some sushi, basking in the glamorous ambiance while we still could. And now we're back in snowy New England, wishing we could be enjoying all the plushness of the Intercontinental in Century City.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gratitude2
Reviews.Content: My family really liked this hotel. The room was spacious and included an office area. My kids loved the pool and hot tub. The food was good too and the employees were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel distress me.....”
Reviews.Author: IntanWan
Reviews.Content: The hotel and it's service were the only comforting factor of my business trip. Was so stressful with work, conference target etc, but i feel so relaxed once back in the room, on comfortable bed. It was pretty quiet at night. My only complaint was, my room was situated above the entrance to their store/kitchen. So every morning there was noise of delivery lorries, trucks came from downstairs which really disturbed my sleep. The rest was great, the service at the counter was impressive. Felt like a celebrity being chauffeured in a Mercedes to the mall, the Hyatt hotel (eventhough it was only within 5-10mins drive, but they happily drove me there). I loove the roses bouquet at the lobby. Highly recommended for business travellers. But not for those tourists, especially from Asia because it is quite far from all the tourist attractions area. Eventhough our conference was held in Hyatt, we were glad we choose to stay in this hotel because Hyatt was too busy. They dont really want to entertain you, unless you really have MONEY!!

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive management when a problem arises.”
Reviews.Author: ds662
Reviews.Content: Valet parking is required at the hotel. On the day of departure one of the parking attendants ran my automobile into a cement pillar. I told the parking director of the problem, he took down a report and they later decided it was not their fault. I then contacted hotel management recieved one reply and then nothing. The damage was $1,200.00 to my automobile and I had to pay AAA parking $80.00 to wreck my car. This is a very expensive hotel and I would have expected better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wished I was closer to the action”
Reviews.Author: cartraveler1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Intercontinental through Hotwire. Last time we came to L.A. we booked the Hotel Palomar in Westwood through Priceline and were very pleased. It's very close to UCLA, parking can be found in the neighborhood, and it has a great happy hour and fairly priced restaurant. That wasn't the case with Intercontinental. It's about a 10 minute drive from Westwood and isn't within walking distance of anything. I really hate to waste money on parking fees when street parking is an option. So, I started driving around the neighborhood instead of paying $35 per night. There's no street parking in any direction for at least a half mile. I went down Olympic to the neighborhoods there, but overnight parking is prohibited, so I sucked it up and went to the valet. As soon as you arrive you're swarmed by 2-3 guys and you don't know if it's bad form to tip one and not the other. So, the parking added up quickly. Internet is $13.95 per day as well, so there are many extras. Lattes are $6, small bottle of water is $5, etc. So, the place really caters to the well to do and not the budget minded traveler who gets a deal on a discount travel site like we did. The rooms are nice. We had a room with two beds. Beware, the beds are full size, so even smaller than a double bed. Not meant for a couple unless you want your arm to go numb in the middle of the night because you can't roll over. Overall, I'm skeptical about this place and whether I'd stay here again. Staff was nice and the place is clean, which are positives.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with complimentary driver”
Reviews.Author: shinrai
Reviews.Content: within 1.5 miles. Hotel itself is located in a business area on the outskirts of Beverly Hills but a short cab ride or a ride from the complimentary hotel car will get you there in a hurry. We had a free upgrade to a suite which was wonderful. Internet access is $12.95/day and valet parking at $35/day is all that is available for parking. In-room phone surcharges are through the roof so use your cell. Overall a pleasant stay with great service.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Fgold44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if you are visiting the Fox lot but apart from that, there are probably better options closer to LA attractions if you are on holidays. It's not a bad hotel but the service wasn't great. I had to ring down from my room multiple times to get most things I needed. The exception to this was the concierge, always helpful and courteous. Gym was average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Most satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: Steven123
Reviews.Content: All the previous positive reviews are spot on. This hotel is beautiful, the rooms luxurious with all the nice amenities and they are quiet and of very nice size. We were upgraded to a corner junior suite which made our stay all the more comfortable indeed. Service is excellent, very friendly and very accessible. The fitness center and outdoor heated pool were very good too. Perhaps the location could be somewhat better, but if you have a car anyway, then it isn't an issue. There is a high end mall (Westfield) less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. And you can use the complimentary limo service if your desired destination is less than 2 miles away. We paid slightly over $200/night and taking into account our excellent stay, that was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vijjano
Reviews.Content: very comfortable....convenience...good staff...will stay again next holiday....

Reviews.Title: “Swankier than the nearby Hyatt Century Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Monterone
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing experience at the InterContinental Hotel in San Francisco (not the Mark Hopkins - the newer one), it was a relief to experience a much higher level of hospitality at this hotel. Service is very warm and solicitous. I was never made to feel like I was a burden when making any request, and in general, everyone seemed to be at the top of their game. The rooms are very large, and the one I was given had a huge balcony (including 2 lounge chairs and two regular chairs) with a 270-degree view of the Los Angeles skyline, as well as two flat-panel TVs. The bathroom was also large, with both a shower and a tub, and the vanity in a separate room. In general, this hotel feels a lot more exclusive and fancy than the nearby Century Plaza (Hyatt Regency), which has much more of a tour-group and convention/conference feel to it. At the same time, the IC Hotel is not quite as centrally located as the Hyatt -- it is about a 10-minute walk farther from the Westfield mall and most of the big office buildings (except for Fox Plaza), including the office that I frequent. The last time I stayed here (4 years ago), this hotel was a Park Hyatt. It seems that not much has been changed, which is actually fine. The furnishings are still holding up, although I can see that a renovation may be needed in another 4-5 years. The gym is exactly the same as it was in the Park Hyatt days (same equipment even). So far, it is still working.... When I need to be near the office, I will stay at the Hyatt, but when I can afford to be a bit farther away, this is where I intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SergioA5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, staff was really helpfull, food was great and the property is very clean. Carlos and David at the bellstan were really friendly and Alex at the bar was great.

Reviews.Title: “A true Intercontinental Experience! Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Semantica
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on two occaisions on business. Once for a week and more recently for just one night. Firstly I would say the staff exceeded my expectations. They were very attentive to my needs and went out of their way to ensure that I had a pleasant stay. The Hotel has a car with driver that will take you anywhere within 3 miles of the Hotel. So they will take you to the Westview shopping area, Beverly Hills etc... The food and drinks at the Hotel, while very good were expensive. We paid $70 for for breakfast for two. That is expensive. Drinks were $16 each! If you want an excellent place for dinner or lunch I would highly recommend Il Fornaio restaurant in Beverly Hills it is incredibly good value. The Hotel car will take you there and pick you up. One last comment for the Hotel Manager... get rid of that Mercedes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob10
Reviews.Content: Overall, I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The outside and lobby areas were all spotless and very updated. The guest rooms were an average size with all the needed amenities for business travelers, relaxing atmosphere. Nice, clean bathrooms with separate tub/shower. The hotel is near an outdoor mall with food options as well as Rodeo Drive for window shopping. Neither are really walking distance but the hotel driver will drop you off and pick up. Otherwise the area seemed pretty quiet. The hotel restaurant is well overpriced, $5.00 for each 10oz. soda.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury? What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Labonneviveuse
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this brief, as hotels this bad don't deserve any review -- not even a negative one. A resounding silence would be more fitting. But if my review helps save someone from the royal pain in the *** of staying at this hotel, it's worth it. The only thing luxurious about this "luxury hotel" is the orchid display in the lobby. What a woeful place it is! On the first night, my colleague and I were given a room in which one of the mattresses had a broken spine, and for the second and third, an L-shaped room by a service elevator. Nothing like being woken up at 6 in the morning by staff shouting at one another. To make matters much, much worse, the place is run by a legion of automatons who keep saying to you, If there's anything we can do, let us know -- and yet cannot actually do even the most simple things you might ask of them. My colleague and I started attempting to predict how the hotel was going to screw up on our latest request. One of their true winners: canceling part of our room service order because someone in the kitchen decided that we were ordering too much food for one person. (We were of course trying to order for two!) And then when we checked out we discovered that -- after all of the delights of our stay -- we were not only not going to get a break on the bill, but they were, rather, going to overcharge us -- and by a huge sum. We got that sorted only to discover that they found the idea of splitting a hotel bill in two an impossible proposition! We stood at the front desk for half an hour while they attempted to sort this, and then had to leave for the airport with it still a mess. It took me -- no joke -- three weeks to get the hotel billed sorted out over the phone. It doesn't matter what you're in LA for -- business or pleasure -- you simply cannot afford the headache of staying here (and paying royally for the little that you get). In over twenty years of travel as an adult, I have never felt so thoroughly ripped off by a hotel. "Luxury" at this place is nothing more than a label they use in their attempt to justify extracting as much money from your wallet during the time you are unfortunate enough to find yourself housed under their roof.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, top end business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJK42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first 2 nights of a 3 week trip to west coast USA. The location was ok for a tourist trip as it was within walking distance (as long as you are keen on walking) of the hop on hop off bus routes, for Hollywood, Beverley Hills & Santa Monica, but not within easy reach of downtown. Room very comfortable and bathroom quite luxurious. Well equipped spa and gym and lovely outdoor pool and jacuzzi Extras were very expensive, eg food and car parking which cost $35 + tax per night - they dont tell you that when they take your car off you at the entrance and there's nowhere else to park. There is a shopping centre with a few restaurants and some fast food about 5-10 minutes away, but otherwise its a long trek or a taxi ride to anywhere to eat if you dont want to shell out a lot of money in the posy hotel restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Timeless Excellence”
Reviews.Author: ArchTrekker
Reviews.Content: Agreed with all of the positive comments about this excellent high end facility. Expensive for parking and meals at restaurant...not for the budget travellers. But sure to look or chain's 'weekend get-away package'. We moved from the disappointing 5-star hotel down the block and found this beautiful facility for about the same price. This also provide for complimentary shuttle service via a Mercedes sedan within 2 miles of the hotel. Wonderful location for morning walks and has a very nice fitness center and pool...no kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: NRX101270
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning. I had a balcony and a stunning view. I also had 3 walls that were just glass. Literally I woke up in the morning to the full view of LA plus a stunning view of Century City. My room was outstanding - although lacking a hair dryer. It was also very quiet. However, there were some drawbacks especially if you are a tourist. This hotel is near nothing. I had been warned but totally didn't understand it. I mean you are in the middle of the Fox backlot. There is nothing - no 7-11; no coffee shop; nothing for a long walk. Also, there is nothing in the hotel. There is allegedly a gift shop but it wasn't opened on the weekend and it only had gourmet candies. No post cards, LA shirts, sundries. Nada. There is a restaurant but it far too swanky for most people and who wants to eat there every day and night. The concierge made me feel like a country bumpkin when I asked about things to do. He suggested art museums (yes that is why I come to LA) and insisted on this tour of LA that the hotel endorsed but was something I did not want to do. The tour was more expensive and was in an enclosed bus. If I am coming to LA, I want to be out in the weather. He did give me info on the cheaper tour with the outdoorsy bus but didn't make me feel good about it. As there was nothing around, I presumed they would have a soda machine or something. But no, they had nothing but a mini bar. $7.00 for a can of soda. No complimentary water (I stayed at a luxury place last year and they offered one bottled water per day) and no snacks of any kind. Then I expect to be gouged on the room service but this was too much. A $4.00 delivery fee; a 25% mandatory gratuity (and they put a spot for additional tip) and tax. I dropped $50 for one meal... which was not that great. They do have a lovely car that guests can reserve but you are limited to Century City, which is big but has little in terms of things to do or food. Plus it is first come first serve, and well, it is a big hotel. If you are here on business, especially for Fox, it is a great place to stay. However, a tourist would do better in a hotel more centrally located to something. Or if you do come here, bring an extra bag of luggage with drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_V6
Reviews.Content: We've been to Los Angeles three times in the last year and have stayed nearby at the Hyatt Regency Century City on past trips so we were excited about this location and went into it knowing that valet parking was $35 per day. No surprises on these fronts. However, we were absolutely delighted with the service at this hotel - the valet was fast and always, always friendly, the housekeeping was fantastic and very curteous, and the conceirage & front desk staff couldn't do more to make our stay wonderful. On the Saturday evening of our stay, there was a red carpet event and we were still treated as important guests, even though we arrived dirty & sandy from the beach. We were lined up with limos for the valet service and did not get bumped just because we weren't "red carpet" ready. Saw some "famous" faces and made the whole "LA" scene a bit more real. The lobby is beautiful and our room was ABSOLUTELY huge. Giant bathroom as well. We liked the seperate shower & tub. We were first time Priceline users who got this hotel at a steal! We would definitely stay at this hotel again - with or without the great Priceline price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mcannie
Reviews.Content: We would return in a minute. We enjoyed 3 days at the hotel & loved the proximity to Century City mall where we were able to easily & safely walk to our favourite restaurant - Houstons. Our room was very spacious, the pool area was lovely & very comfortable, the number of TV stations on our TV was amazing, the concierge & valet staff were the best we've encountered & the hotel wase hosting a BBC America pre-Emmy party so we spotted some stars whilst sipping prosecco. A great place to unwind after a transatlantic flight & it prepares you well for the rest of your holiday. Would highly recommend anyone to visit this lovely hotel, we certainly will next time we are in LA. ,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent upper-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcdowntown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a number of times from June to August and was happy each time. The hotel is a good example of the InterContinental chain. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. (The most tourist appeal probably lies in the rooms overlooking the soundstages that face one side of the hotel.) The staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The hotel has a shuttle service for the surrounding area that is complimentary and lessens one's need for a car. But if you want to get out of the immediate area, a car is essential. The hotel is not located near anything that most visitors would consider in walking distance. I stayed here primarily because the hotel was very conveniently located for the business I was in town to conduct. The food at the hotel is serviceable but LA has a lot more to offer in that department. I also found the InterContinental more appealing than the Century Plaza (a Hyatt operation) just up the street: the rooms are a bit more comfortable at the IC, and the Century Plaza was only about $10 cheaper at the rates I was interested in paying.

Reviews.Title: “A bit isolated, but a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawgfan1995
Reviews.Content: It is likely that the same can be said for nearly all of LA, but this hotel in Century City felt isolated. It is fairly near a mall and the Fox headquarters on Avenue of the Stars, but it is LA - you need a car for sure. We stayed here for our trip because it is close to the office building at which we were working. Other than the rather isolated feel to its location, this hotel is very nice -- very plush, new, and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast service poor but rooms and location are excellent”
Reviews.Author: BA1aSilverstar
Reviews.Content: This is a good Inter-Continental (it used to be a Hyatt) - excellent location near a Westfield Shopping Complex next to 20th Century Fox if I recall, but I would advise making sure that you come by car. We stayed over a New Year period. There was a power cut but the staff kept the drinks flowing in the bar and everything was fine. Breakfast service was Ok to terrible - food coming at dfferent times and everything felt like a hassle. The hotel has a great leisure club and an excellent pool - very quiet when we stayed. We had a lovely suite with a balcony overloooking the Hollywood Sign and LA. Room Service was also good. I had booked a twin bedroom but we were up-graded to a suite with a pull out bed in the lounge - we had to call down 3 times and go to the Reception desk in the middle of the night to ask for the sofa bed to be made up. Apart from these small problems it is a good hotel and I would stay again when I back in LA or Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “$35 for PARKING!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: portiabenz
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a nice hotel however the price for valley parking was ridiculous and for the price I was really upset that it took nearly 10 minutes to get my car!!!! When my friends and I got to the front desk they swiped my card which was fine, however they did not tell me they would be taking out an extra $100 for the security deposit!!!!! I only found out when I called my bank as soon as i got to the room!!!! Most hotels TELL you that they are taking out extra for security! The room was smaller than expected and there was no oversized tub!!!!! we had not been in the room for more than five minutes when my friend noticed that there was a used towel damp in the bathroom!!!!!!! Gross!! and opened shampoo bottles in the shower! The only thing good about the room was the view from the balcony...but for that price I couldve gotten a better room with a view as well. The bed was pretty comfortable but thats about it. Stay at one of the nearby hotels!!!!! NOT WORTH THE PRICE ESPECIALLY WHEN YOU ADD THE PRICE OF PARKING!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect (if you have a car)”
Reviews.Author: Hooleybooley
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get our 3 night stay for 'free' using our Priority club points, the only thing we paid for was the Valet parking and Wifi - this was £84 for 3 nights car park and 2 days wifi. The hotel is central to all of the 'tourist' places: Hollywood was 20mins drive, Beverly Hills 10mins tops, Santa Monica 15mins - all travel times are during the weekend (not rush hour). We got an excellent v. modern room on the 5th floor with a balcony view of LA and Fox Studios below. The room was cleaned everyday, staff were friendly and everything in the room looked new or less than a year old. We couldn't wish for a better place for what we wanted. We didn't have the hotel breakfast as we went to John O'Groats on Pico for breakfast on the first day (recommended by the concierge) and returned every day after that. This hotel is perfect if you have a car and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to sightsee the area in a limited number of days.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LeapingGazelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife on our tailor made holiday to LA & Las Vegas. After much searching we decided to book this hotel and what a great descision this was. LA is a massive spralling city and no hotel is close to everything. The hotel is a 5 - 10 minute walk from the Westfield Century City Mall which has an array of great bars, restaurants and shops. Taxi's are readily available outside the hotel and the hotel itself has a complimentary car to take you on very local trips (1 1/2 miles max). We walked form the hotel to the Beverly Hills City limit which was no more than a 20 minute walk. The hotel was very clean, freindly and relaxed. The Concierge was really helpful with booking restaurants and general travel advice. Our room was wonderful, with its own terrace and on the 28th floor looking over the Fox studios. We really enjoyed our stay and when we go back to LA, we will be stying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: etoilchen
Reviews.Content: two years ago, i stayed there for a couple of nights. been there for my first time and it was great. we rented a car and spent all day discovering the beauty of california.

Reviews.Title: “very nice property, friendly with small kids”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights over fourth of July weekend and had a great time. Were staying on priority club points and got upgraded to a Deluxe Suite. Had wonderful views over LA, Fox Studios and saw all the way to the Ocean. We had breakfast at the hotel and each morning enjoyed wonderful service in the restaurant. We were travelling with our 13 months old daugther and were very grateful that they were so accommodating to her. I would definitely go back to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “room service ripoff”
Reviews.Author: NewportBeach1952
Reviews.Content: 21% room service gratuity plus an additional charge $3.75 room service delivery charge is just dishonest. When topped off with tax for 2 bottles of Pellegrino at $20.00 resulted in an additonal charge of $10.75 for the service. . This was after we were able to negotiate with them to only charge us $14 instead of $42. for a pot of coffee. I must add that the $42 was not a mistake but what they charge for a pot of latte that is exactly likek coffee and milk. When we spoke with the desk person in charge she was very hostile and initially refused to budge on the coffee. The service charges stayed the same as they are hotel policy. We had a package with American Express that included breakfast up to $65 and a weekend food credit for $85. It seems that the hotel makes up for this by outrageous service charges. Room was very nice, clean, and food good.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Roxii
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire at a great rate. The hotel was about a 20 minute walk to century city mall, and wasn't near much of the happening area. This could be a good thing or bad thing depending on the person. Good Things: I liked the fact that it was a quiet hotel. Valet was very quick and efficient. Very comfortable beds, good size room. Bathroom towels/linens were clean, and loved the separate shower and tub. Bad Things: Knowing I was 1 person, I got a room with 2 doubles. When asked to switch rooms to a King it became a lot of hassle for them. After going into 2 rooms (that apparently was only available) that smelt like smoke, I opted to stay in the 2 Double Bed room. This hotel I believe is supposed to be smoke free. Bellhops are pretty bothersome, trying to take your luggage even when you say you're fine. The pool area, although beautiful and comfortable, is in an area where you get high winds. It is therefore an area that ends up being cold, so you can't enjoy sitting outside by the pool. It's VERY chilly on a hot day. Maybe when it goes into the high 90's and above it won't be as bad. I was there during mid 80's where Santa Monica Beach was hotter. Even though I had a lot of bad things, I might stay again. I guess it depends on price. The room itself was fabulous, the front desk could have been more accommodating. I'm hoping that if I end up staying here again, I will have a better experience. Just to finalize this all, I've been to the Hyatt down the street which is a great hotel and probably prefer that over the Intercontinental when it comes to the pool area. It is, however more of a family hotel and louder than the Intercontinental. Intercontinental also does have more of a luxurious feel than the Hyatt Century City Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MONTES
Reviews.Content: the hotel is fairly nice, the rooms are somewhat in the small size, but the hotel is in a good location near Westfield shopping center (three blocks away-a walking distance). there is a 35 dollar a night parking fee

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this circa 80s hotel... but it could use updating and better-trained staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Priceline for a very low rate... so I definitely got my money's worth. The hotel looks fancy from Ave. of the Stars and the large lobby, with all the fresh cut flowers and soaring glass ceiling, is very impressive. The rooms are not large, not small, but probably last decorated about 10 years ago. They're well-kept and clean, except for the lumpy, spring beds. A/C is hard to program (thermostats have been used incorrectly) and a little loud. Definitely subpar for a 4-star hotel. On the plus side, we were treated really well even though we were staying for less than 50% of the rated listed online. Parking is only valet, and that will set you back $33 plus tax. We opted to park several blocks away in a residential area, which was inconvenient but worked out well. The business center staff was a little less than friendly, and they charge you $7.50 for 20 minutes online... a little steep. Loved the location, in Century City, 5 minutes to B. Hills and Westwood and 10 to the 405. Would definitely go back for the low rates... which should continue to exist until they finally model the hotel... it's definitely a trip back to 1989 as it stands now.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLonghorn
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome deal on Hotwire. The room was top notch as was the service. Actually, the service was almost too good! Our car was swarmed with people helping us unload when we arrived. But, as soon as I said "I have it," they were fine. And, when I realized I forgot my cell phone in the car while checking in, the person at the front desk immediately said "don't worry, we'll get it" and 5 minutes later they delivered it to the room. The room was wonderful - spacious and clean. The bathroom had a separate tub and shower and great Elemis products.

Reviews.Title: “Location Good - miserable woman on front desk!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie99uk
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel and first impressions were good - check in was swift and we were upgraded to lovely suite - front desk at this point were delightful! Arrived quite late at night and wanted to grab something quick to eat in the hotel restaurant - food a bit fancy for our liking so we ordered room service and were able to grab burgers and grilled cheese (comfort food after a long flight when you're starving). Food arrived promptly, was well presented and tasty. Hotel has valet parking - no problems with this - car always ready for us if we called down 10 mins before setting out. Hotel within walking distance to Westfield Century City Mall and, if you're energetic, walking distance to Rodeo Drive, Beverley Hills. LA is a car city and we found the hotel to be a good location for visiting Universal Studios, Griffiths Observatory, Getty Museum, Santa Monica - generally car journeys were about 30 mins allowing for traffic. Hotel has a nice outdoor pool area with a hot tub. Pool a good size with towels provided. My only negative experience of this hotel was at check-out when the member of staff was extremely rude and disrespectful - she treated me like I was inconviencing her as I was checking out and when I requested copies of my final bills (there were 2 rooms). After check out she very insincerely quoted the "I hope you enjoyed your stay at ... I hope you return soon" etc speech - I wish I'd said something to her at the time about her attitude. I later found out she had refunded the wrong credit card despite my clear instructions as to which card I wanted money returned to - I just knew she wasn't listening to me at the time! It's a shame that the attitude of one desk clerk can sour a persons overall experience of what is fundamentally a good choice for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantatstic Stay in super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewt3233
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our friends on the first 3 nights of our USA trip. Extremely welcoming when we arrived fom the moment the Car Valet gentelemn helped unload the car, explained the valet parking and directed us to reception. On arrival only 1 of the rooms was available, as we had requested close/adjoining rooms - this was not a problem as we said we would put all luggage in the one room for the time being. Massive room, large LCD TV, lovely Kind Bed with feather mattress topper, balcony overlooking the front of the hotel, large bathroom with tub, shower cubicle and large sink area. Actually ended up with interconnecting rooms with our friends which was great - they even had a double aspect room with 2 balconies. The car was always ready after we had called down to the valet and each time we arrived back at the hotel we were greeted with " Welcome back sir!" Didn't eat in the hotel as we prefer to try local restaurants etc (also the hotel was a bit pricey from food). Ideally located about 3 blocks from the Westfield Century City Mall, with a host of restaurants and good shops. Must visit Farmers Market and The Grove at Farmers Market if you visit LA. Would defeinetly return to the Intercontinental if returning to LA again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - NO Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: BornaTravelinMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for the weekend (Friday - Sunday). Booked on Priceline for $95 bucks a night. This is the second time I have been hit at this hotel. The lobby is nice and the doormen/front desk staff are very friendly. The Room is nice, although a renovation would improve my ratings from a B- to an A. The location is decent - about 5 miles from the Bev Hills/Rodeo area and about 5 miles to the Santa Monica/Montana area. The big negative - hot water in the shower. Both stays - took literally 35 minutes of running the water. This is a huge negative for me. Net/Net - a nice hotel with some issues - not trendy and more for business than leisure. However, at 95 bucks, I cant complain much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: pjrjcjam
Reviews.Content: Adjacent to Fox studios and located on the old 20th Century Fox lot in Century City, the Intercontinental is very convenient to Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, and a short drive to Culver City and downtown LA. Hotel is very nice and staff is very attentive. Rooms are clean and spacious, and sweeping room views are incredible - can see up into Beverly Hills and Hollywood and across to downtown Los Angeles. I've stayed here three times on business and think it's a great hotel in a convenient area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay- exceptional service and pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: NYCLizzie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Every staff member here goes way above and beyond to make you feel looked after and comfortable. The hotel itself is clean and well maintained, nice furnishings and plenty of space. Conference facilities, the gym and pool are all up to par. Most rooms have beautiful views. The restaurant is great but it's quite expensive (you're paying for what you're getting). The location is not in the middle of a busy neighborhood, it's quiet but a good place from which you can get to Beverly Hills and Weho. But really what's made an impression on me is the staff, they really are professionals and if you have events to plan I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mercedesbenz
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental Los Angeles. Our room had an extra room attached with a desk and sitting area. Everything was clean and nicely decorated. There is a small butl well equipped gym that is free to use for guests. The Concierge were friendly and helped us find restaurants and directions. The restaurant was very expensive (like most restaurants in 4 star hotels). We eat breakfast there on the first morning but eat breakfast somewhere else the next day. The negative to this hotel is the location. The Century City mall is about 3 blocks walking distance but that is it. You can't walk anywhere else, you need a car. Although the Mall is great and has a huge movie theatre, a supermarket and a great food court. The hotel offers only valet parking and it is $32 a night. I believe there is also a complimentary car service that will take you within a 1 mile radius of the hotel and pick you up, although we never used it. Overall, a lovely comfortable elegant hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwine127
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and pretty central location but quite expensive in my view. Unfortunately hotel was full of kids involved in talent competition during our stay. Staff were very helpful and courtesy car a bonus. Nice views from hotel over city and Hollywood sign in distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Auntie_L_9
Reviews.Content: When you first walk in the standard room, you won't think it's all that luxurious, considering it's a 4 star hotel. BUT, the bathroom really is exquisite, and the bed and bedding was simply the most comfortable ever. EVER. It was that nice. Plus, the heater/cooler has a fan that consistently stays on, if you want it to, so that you don't have the sounds of heat or cold going on and off. And it makes a very slight white noise sound in the background, which I really liked. Lastly - the parking was $32 per car, per night, which is a little high, even for L.A. standards. (No self-park was available.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Location not ideal”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGalDublin
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, rooms are big. Its clean and overall quite good. We had a bit of trouble with room not being cleaned and food service, but it was overall a good hotel. The location is not great if you didn't have a car. Its basically in the middle of corporate TV towers. We pricelined and got it at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at quite a few Intercontinentals across the US and Europe, and although the brand is certainly a guarantee of a certain standard, there are often significant differences between individual hotels. The LA hotel is well located for Rodeo Drive shops, which are only a few blocks away, and is right next to the Century City Mall which has some good restaurants (Rock Sugar (Asian) is brilliant). The rooms are a little dated (corridors, doors, walls, room lighting) apart from the nice LCD. We stayed in a junior suite which was average sized, with a queen bed, and had only very basic amenities in the bathroom. Overall, good, but there are better choices in LA. We had just come back from the newly opened Encore hotel in Las Vegas so the stark contrast could be the reason we felt the hotel room was antiquated...so take our review with a pinch of salt!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Service...Definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I wanted to treat my wife with a night on the town. I booked the hotel on priceline the night before and got it for a fabulous rate of $125. I have stayed at the Hotel Intercontinental in SF and loved it. We pulled up to the hotel and was met by 2 valet men. Check in was a breeze (granted it was 7pm) and we were pleasantly surprised to see that we were automatically upgraded to a beautiful jr. suite. Room- There was a sepearate seating area with couch. The bed was just OK (that is probably the only knock on the hotel). The bathroom was large and had seperate shower and tub. We did not touch the minibar and enjoyed the coffee. All in all, it was a very nice room. Amneities- We utilized the workout room and thought it was very nice and clean. All of the cardio equipment had a built in TV. The pool looked very inviting. Service- I thought the service was very very good. We easily got extended check out till 1pm. The valet service was very prompt (better be for $35). All in all, I would definitely stay here again. Especially if we could get it for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: We needed to nice place to stay as my husband was flying out of LAX and all the hotels close to the airport basically suck. This is 11 miles from LAX, beautiful room, great service and fantastic value. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SDFULK
Reviews.Content: We were truly happy with this hotel. Beautiful lobby, both inside and out side. Very clean, hygienic and tidy rooms, extremely friendly staff. We had room service for breakfast and dinner and it was delicious. Very convenient location to Beverly Hills/Bel Air area and not too far from the beaches, Hollywood and the Sunset Strip and Rodeo Drive. Bed, pillow etc. are extremely comfortable. We would definitely stay there next time and we can recommend this hotel without any hesitation. Not even one complaint but…internet should be complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, decent price at InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: tpowell12
Reviews.Content: My room: Clean and tidy for the most part, but there was some dust in not very noticeable places (baseboards, etc). The balcony was nice, two chairs fit easily on the balcony. I'm on a diet, so the weight scale was a plus. The amenities are failrly standard, but I wish they had a mirror in the room itself. Wireless Internet is over $12/day, so I never bothered to use my laptop at the hotel. Check-In/Service: Check in wasn't a problem. Easy, quick, efficient. Maybe a little too efficient. Value: I'd never stayed in Century City before. The price was about what I expected given the location, but I think there might be better values around the area. Food: Never ate at the hotel, honestly. The nearby mall has a good selection, but you'll want a car to get there. Speaking of Parking: Valet. Not bad. $30 or so, pretty typical. I never had to wait long to get my car. I might not stay here if I didn't have a car. Reservation: I booked my room online several months in advance at the hotel website- http://intercontinentallosangeles.com/index.html. No problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a good central location”
Reviews.Author: travelchica
Reviews.Content: We grabbed this room on priceline (asked for a 4-star near Beverly Hills) and this was a great hotel for the price. It is convenient to many of the spots of L.A. (Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Malibu, Hollywood, downtown) if you don't mind driving a short distance to some of the locations. The service was great - the valet was so nice! - even so were the front desk staff and housekeeping. The lobby was similar to an upscale hotel and had a decent lobby bar. The rooms were clean and spacious and had very comfy beds. Each room appeared to have a small balcony and ours overlooked the Avenue of the Stars and provided a nice view of the Hollywood hills. The Ave of the Stars sounds like it would be a busy location, but rather quiet since it is a couple blocks from the Century City shops and a little west of Beverly Hills. Next time I may stay somewhere more in the thick of everything else or near one of the beach towns, but it was nice to have a central spot and nice hotel for that price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel....for business”
Reviews.Author: julj1
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, but very business oriented. you'd think internet should be complimentary in this type if hotel, but it's not. also, parking was quite expensive (32$/day) location isn't bad, walking distance to rodeo drive. but not the best option for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “What a fitness room!”
Reviews.Author: sakio
Reviews.Content: This place is quickly becoming one of my favorites in West LA. I stayed here for 4 nights in April and once again in July. I have to say the place was as good as I remember and better than 99% of the hotels in Los Angeles. The rooms are average for the price range, but is extremely clean. There is a flat screen in all the rooms with ample channels available (in HD, no less). The fitness room is very well furnished. 4 treadmills, 3 ellipticals, 5 bikes (2 standard and 3 reclining), plus pretty much all the weight machines available on the market. All the cardio equipment has an LCD TV built into it and they offer headphones right at the gym if you forgot yours. The room is very well lit (it faces the gorgeous pool), not like many of the hotels in their fluorescent glory. They also have a great spa that I would recommend. The restaurant is top notch for a hotel restaurant. They even offered me a $20 discount coupon when I checked in. If you may have noticed, I haven't said much about the surrounding. That's because Century City has so little to do. There is a mall about 5 blocks down the road, so it's not that bad, but other than that, you will need to drive for fun. If you have to do business in Century City or Hollywood, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotelbuffFlorida
Reviews.Content: WOW! We were truly happy with this hotel. Was somewhat unsure after reading some reviews on it's location, but truly did not find it to be off the beaten path. We were close to Beverly Hills and just a short drive to the "tourist" areas. First, this hotel is just beautiful. The pics do not do it justice. We checked in on the Amex package with a free upgrade. And it was a true upgrade. A junior suite!! We were traveling with our two boys, on our 6th night, so it made it nice to have our own room. The junior suite they gave us looked brand new as if it had never been used. We had a great view of the old Century City studios (now Fox). It was a nice view from the 15th floor! We had room service for breakfast and it was delicious. The boys ordered off the kids menu and the portions were huge. My husband said his breakfast was the best breakfast he remembered having in a long time. The rooms each have a Kourig coffee maker in them with Emeril's coffee which was especially good. They also had a nice coffee station located in the posh lobby (as early as 4:00am--time we had to leave for our flight) which really made it nice. The staff was very good--my only complaint was that I think that they must let their maid staff go home early because we waited a very long time to get the pull out couch made up for the boys. Bed was very comfortable but boys did not think the pull out was very comfortable at all. We dined for lunch in their hotel restaurant because we had a $100 credit. The waiter was nice and the food was very tasty---however it was overprice. We would not have normally paid $110 for lunch (which is what it came to) but we did have the credit. I do think that this hotel caters to the business man/woman traveler, so on the weekends this hotel is nice and quiet. We got a fantastic rate of only $220 per night, so it was well worth it. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and do feel you will enjoy it as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler1844
Reviews.Content: While we usually stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Century City, Los Angeles, we stayed three nights at the InterContinental Century City. What a lovely hotel. We were on the 8th floor overlooking 20th Century Fox back lot. The room was very spacious and bathroom was large with both a tub and shower. Didn't really mind paying the $30 per night for valet parking as the car was always there waiting when we came down to the lobby. Those valet guys really move quickly. Television was nice in the room, really comfortable beds and lovely bedding too. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Athens85
Reviews.Content: After a long journey in California we decided to spend the last night in Intercontinental in Los Angeles. The hotel is simply fantastic and has all the you expect from a 5 Stars Hotel: extremely friendly staff in all the hotel (congierge, reception, valet parking,.etc), very good rooms with a superbe view over Los Angeles,etc. Bathroom was simply a dream! The hotel offers also a nice swimming pool and a SPA. We booked a package with breakfast that was very good. At all an excellent experience. Nothing to complain about!Sure 100% again to Intercontinental Centry City.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wapondi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Intercontinental for 2 nights. We booked through Priceline and paid $150 a night. Keep in mind though, that they charge you an additional $30 a day for valet parking (and there is no self-parking). Our room was gorgeous. We had three huge windows and a wrap-around balcony. The room was very tastefully decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is pretty big with a stand alone shower and separate bathtub. The exercise room is one of the nicer ones we've seen and the pool is just lovely. Everyone who worked there was very friendly. When you come back to the hotel for the day they say "welcome back!" We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2-bed room on the 10th floor, overlooking the Fox Studios. The beds, look to be narrower than a regular queen-sized bed. I had called in advance to request a baby crib, but it was not there upon arrival. However, when the crib did come, it came with a very nice set of Simple baby products. The beds, while small, were comfortable. And there was an iHome and a Kreug coffee machine. The bathroom had a separate bathtub and shower, and Elemis toiletries. We were 3 adults but the room seemed to be set up for 2 people as there were 2 sets of everything (cups, glasses, towels, etc). There was only 1 pair of room slippers, I had to call for more. The complimentary town car consisted of 1 Mercedes S-class limo. Our longest wait was 30 mins, shortest was immediate. It is allowed to bring you anywhere within a 1.5-mile distance of the hotel. The lobby was quiet and peaceful, which I appreciate. The staff were polite but I won't consider them friendly. Valet parking was $30 per day, and they charged me an extra day, which they quickly took back when I pointed out their mistake. They also charged me for internet access which I didn't use and an extra orange juice for breakfast, all of which were taken back with no questions asked, as soon as I pointed it out to them. All in all, I had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rovingfamilyman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental during a conference in late April. I was impressed with all aspects of the service from the reception (courteous and prompt), valet parking (extremely fast and helpful), concierge (very helpful) and housekeeping (thorough and unobtrusive). The restaurant was very good but service could be a bit spotty, The conference was at the nearby Hyatt. By the comments I received from my colleauges, the Intercontinental was definitely the better option. Thelocation allowed for easy access (by car) to the Beach (Santa Monica and Malibu), Beverley Hills, Mullholland and even Hollywood. The shopping mall at Avenue of the Stars and Santa Monica was also really handy for last minute gifts. I had a jog around the nearby golf course and thought that the area surrounding the course was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: njs4572
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing price on hotwire for this hotel in century city. Beds and Pillows amazingly comfy. Gym not too overcrowded and really nice for hotel gym. Pool has these great cabanas - the only complaint was that it was a bit crowded. Wished I had time to go to the spa but was out and about too much. Really nice location and although valet always expensive in LA - you pay per day so can come and go as you please. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GreatstayLa
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel and service! Definitely a place I would return to with or without priceline! The service from the moment I arrived was helpful and very professional. The lobby was an amazingly elegant view with great views of the restaurant and bar. Once I got to my room , the view was amazing. Couches and room was amazing, beautiful decor beds were great! Furnishings and bathroom was very high end and felt just like home! Great large screen plasma screens in both bedroom and living room!

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: Patty39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for 5 nights and wished I could have stayed longer. While it is true that you need a car to get around, that is true of almost any hotel you stay in while in Los Angeles! The location, in West L.A. offers great access to the Westwood, Beverly Hills, even Hollywood areas without having to be right next to a freeway. My room, a corner room, had a balcony and private patio with chaise lounge chairs and patio table. The huge LCD / HDTV was gorgeous and the IPod clock radio wasa nice plus as was the cutting edge coffee maker. No request was too much while I stayed at the hotel, including bringing in a rollaway bed for the one night one of my children stayed with me. The beds were dreamy with the best linens, pillows and covers you can imagine. From the valet to the concierge, everyone went way out of their way to accomodate my every request, always with a smile. I will definitely stay here again, even with the $ 30 valet parking charge. One more thing...because the hotel is right next to Fox Studios and their corporate building, Fox puts up many of their celebraties here. It was fun to start gaze in my own hotel lobby!

Reviews.Title: “started great but quickly went down hill”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at this hotel for 2 nights for work. following a long weekend in Santa Monica. Check in was smooth- the valet were quite nice as my husband would only be with me a few hours so they did not charge us a full fee. The bell man was quite helpful and the room was gorgeous- I had a junior suite with two separate balconies. The room was clean but contained no toilet paper so i had to call for that. My husband and i enjoyed the pool- the water was very warm which was a treat. The bartender at the pool was not nice- he seemed quite annoyed when i was not sure what I wanted (no one else was waiting). The "complimentary car" stops running quite early even though they tell you it will run late- not a big deal but still.... After the pool, there was a note in my room saying that the power would be out the following day for 2.5 hours during a critical time for me. i was attending a red carpet event and needed to get ready during that time. the manager on duty said they could get me into a GYM to get ready- UM NO that will not work for a hollywood red carpet event. my colleagues were able to get us out of the hotel for the second night which was great. i did sleep well and was impressed with the TV selection for the night I was there. i have to agree with a previous poster about details- there is not attention to them here. Lastly- check out was a nightmare- the desk clerk was VERY rude- she said they had charged me for both nights but would reimburse me for the second night but it took a lot of persistence to get that receipt showing my reimbursement. She seemed annoyed with me when I asked for that. while the rooms were nice and the pool was great, i will not be going back to this hotel anytime soon. Rude staff is not acceptable when I am a guest.

Reviews.Title: “A solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights while in LA. Overall the service was good, the rooms were clean and spacious and the location was great for business in the Century City, Hollywood, Bel Air or Hollywood locations. There are a few downsides to the hotel. The lighting in the bathrooms in horrible. Even with all the lights on the bathroom was really dark. Management tried to help by putting it wall-sized mirrors over the bathtub but it didn't help significantly. And who really wants to have a mirror in that location! Also, the bathtub was shallow -- if you like to relax in a soaking tub at the end of a busy day, this won't cut it. The towels were nice and fluffy with quality amenities. The spa was also a letdown. I walked down to see about a simple manicure. The women sitting at the desk promised me a call to confirm a time the next day. No call came....until 2:15pm the following day asking if I was running late. Huh? No-one ever called to confirm an appointment and they still tried to charge me. The room service food was good. They were quick with the delivery and the food was tasty and hot. The valet service was speedier than most and I never had to wait over 5 minutes for my car to be brought. That is a big plus for them!!! Overall, a solid business hotel but there are better spots close by that I prefer.

Reviews.Title: “A Gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissDHappy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inter-Continental for three lovely nights. The hotel itself is immaculately clean and beautifully decorated. My room was spectacular and had a huge bathroom. Bedding and amenities were top-notch. I was hooked as soon as I walked in the room and classical music was playing! The staff could not have been more helpful and the spa services were both reasonably priced and so relaxing. As others have posted, the location makes things a bit tricky if you do not have a car. However, I took the bus to Santa Monica with ease and walked to the nearby Westfield Mall. I was beyond pleased with my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced for the $240 per night we paid (all-in), but overall a pretty swank place to stay. Rooms were clean, gym was kick-ass. Didn't get a chance to use the outdoor heated pool, but it looked nice (albeit a bit too shallow). Very same and clean area, although there isn't much to do in walking distance either. You're not far from West Hollywood, Bel Air, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Hollywood by car. Your only option is to valet park, which is a bit steep at $30 per day. But you get free in/out privileges. Breaktast is $20 each and limited in variety, so we ended up going elsewhere for a change of venue. Rooms are clean, but there's no fridge, and even the bottled water isn't complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FLLtraveler
Reviews.Content: Very impressed! Recently renovated corner room #712 was very spacious and had excellent views north and west over the Fox backlot all the way to the Pacific. Everything was very well maintained and very clean. Service throught was refined, prompt and professional. Relatively convenient location (as long as you have a car or can use the hotel's compimentary car) is close to Beverly Hills & West Hollywood. We chose this area over Hollywood and after seeing Hollywood Blvd., we were very happy that we chose this location. Hollywood Blvd. still has a long way to go and is very touristy and still seedy. Hotel has complimentary Town Car drop off/pick up within 1.5 mile radius up until 10:00 PM. Spa area was great. Hotel is within walking distance of Westfield Century City mall, which was much nicer than the Beverly Center. Great selection of shops and nice restaurants in a pleasant outdoor setting. We did not eat at the hotel but had excellent dinners at Angelini Osteria, Angeli Caffe & Mastro's Steakhouse. I'm extremely fussy and I would not hesitate to stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honka
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during Christmas week and our stay was perfect. We found the staff very friendly and really helpful. The rooms where excellent the food was very nice. All I would say is that I would make sure you have a car if you are going to be using this hotel as it is a little out of the way, other than that I had a really nice stay and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: KrisKros
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our roadtrip in the US, and what a grand final it was. We totally loved our stay at the Intercontinental Hotel, Century City in LA. The hotel, the lobby, the rooms – everything were all beautiful – top notch, and very quiet. Even if we had booked through Hotwire, and our rental car looked like a mess after 2236 miles on the road, we were treated like king and queens when we finally arrived at the hotel. No fuss at all. The hotel is ideally located on the Avenue of the Stars, in the West LA district near Beverly Hills and Century Plaza Towers. It took us just minutes to get to Rodeo Drive and Westfield Century City Mall. LAX is located about 11 miles from the hotel. I guess it took us 30 min to get to the airport, in traffic. So all in all a very convenient location if you have a car. If you don’t have one, I would stay somewhere else. Didn’t really get to use any amenities at the hotel, but checked out both the pool-area and the fitness-room, which looked fabulous. No excuses if you’re supposed to work-out on your trip, in other words.. The valet parking is steep, but hi – that’s to be expected in LA. Wanted to check out a Nike-outlet in the area, but the concierge only knew about the Nike Store next to Wilshire Grand. Also to be expected in Beverly Hills…. Based on my experience, I would def. recommend this hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star property”
Reviews.Author: goo0325
Reviews.Content: Hotel was generally nice. I think they are trying to be something that they are not though. All staff encountered were friendly and appeared to be trying their best. Valet and doormen were superb and I do not mind paying $30.00 per night when the service is as excellent as what they provided. Not just on 1 day-- I was there for 4 days and that area was consistently superior. As others have posted-- housekeeping was inconsistent. There were 2 of us in 1 room. When we checked in, there were 3 sets of towels in the room. On day two, only two sets were left. On day 3- five sets were left. Seemed a little odd. Also, during turndown service-- one attendant would empty garbage, refresh used towels and fill ice bucket. The others we had did not do that and only turned down the bed. Room was very well appointed. New carpet and bedding. If you looked beyond the surface though the baseboards were covered with dust. One lamp had a cigarette burn. On the top of the desk lamp, someone had used the metal plate to put out a cigarette and this was never cleaned by housekeeping on the 4 days I was there. I will say that the room did not smell like smoke at all, so they obviously did a good job getting rid of the smoke smell-- just not cleaning up the ashes. If the room would have smelled of smoke on my arrival, I would have changed rooms. I had requested a synthetic filled pillow because of an alergy to feather pillows. Twice, feather pillows were delivered. The housekeeper who delivered the pillows was very sweet and she really wanted to do the right thing, but said that she did not know the difference in the pillow types. She was able to find the correct pillows. Workout facility and pool were fine. Food and beverage was of high quality and service was okay. One other weird thing did happen during the course of my stay--- the patio chairs were removed after day two and replaced with old ripped ones. I have no idea what this was all about, but I had taken pictures when I arrived, so I know that I was not imagining it. It would take a lot of training and probably a change of leadership to get this hotel near 4 or 5 star level. Price was fair, but I would stay at the Century plaza next time.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Century City - it's all about the details”
Reviews.Author: image1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the Century City Intercontinental Hotel in November of 2007. We booked our stay with Hotwire and paid $219/night... it was a little expensive compared to what other reviewers paid, but we basically booked it within a month, so it was the cheapest I could find in the Beverly Hills/Century City area. I was really excited to stay here, but mostly because I haven't been on vacation for a long time. After booking with Hotwire, I called the hotel and put in a request with reservations for a nice room with a king bed and a nice view - plus, we had a flat screen TV, which was a nice touch. Fortunately for us, when we arrived, they had honored our request, which was really nice! We stayed in 1512 and had a great view since it was a corner unit. Overall, I would say that this hotel is very nice - definitely a 3 to 3.5 star hotel. The details are what brought down its rating in my book (see the end of my review for more). It's obviously more suited to the business traveler, but is centrally located near good shopping - you've got Venice Beach to the West and West Hollywood to the East. There is a free concierge car service to Rodeo Drive in the heart of Beverly Hills, which is a nice touch - however, they warn you that they won't go beyond Rodeo Drive and the hours aren't conducive to late nights. The lobby was really nice and the 24 hour exercise facility was excellent. Make sure to go to the spa and ask for a locker and you will have access to the spa's nice shower area. The locker room closes at 11 pm, but the spa closes at 9 pm. If you want to use the locker room from 9-11 pm, make sure to go to concierge and ask for a key there. A lot of reviewers are shocked at the price of room service and the items in the mini fridge, but seriously, you're staying at a 4 star hotel within 2 miles of Beverly Hills, what do you expect? I wouldn't be stupid enough to order room service or grab anything out of the fridge. Instead, head to the Century City Westfield Mall, about a mile away and go to the grocery store, Gelson's, and pick up some snacks there. Although the fridge is sealed, you can also chill your drinks using the ice basket provided. One nice touch is that they provide you with free Fiji water - we got 3 each time they cleaned the room. Note, they do a general cleaning in the morning AND a turn down service at night, so they will knock on your door before noon and probably around 8 or 9 pm. The turndown service is also really nice touch. One thing about the cleaning service: we stayed for 5 nights at the hotel and we noticed a drop off in the quality of the cleaning towards the end of our stay - for instance, not all the towels were replenished and we no longer received 3 bottles of Fiji, but only 2. Again, head to the Century City mall for most of your dining needs as it is not only a gorgeous outdoor mall, but the food is very fresh and there is a LOT of selection at the food court and other dining establishments. DETAILS: Although our guest room (1512) was impressive at first glance, there were some issues I observed that brought down my overall impression at the Intercontinental Century City. First of all, the heating and A/C unit was very loud, but functioned very well. Secondly, the price of wireless internet access was exorbitant (nearly $10/day!). A hotel of this caliber should have free wireless access, especially considering the amount of business clients at the hotel. Note: you can go to the business center (not the greatest at all) and also pay for internet access), but you can also go to a little cubby near the check in desk... there is a tiny claustrophobic space where they have a free internet terminal. Sometimes people stand in a line waiting to use it, so just be aware of that. Thirdly, there were no in-room mirrors (they were only in the bathroom), so it was inconvenient getting dressed before we left our room. Fourthly, the cost of mandatory valet parking was ridiculous. Although I understand that the custom in LA is pay parking (a lot of places, such as the Westfield Mall offer the first 1.5 to 3 hours free), $30 a day is quite high - HOWEVER, the valet service was excellent, so it felt like you were getting what you paid for. Lastly, the bathroom also looked impressive upon first glance... however, upon closer inspection, I was shocked at the lack of attention to detail. For instance, the bathroom countertop was not properly attached to the wall, so where it connected, instead of a waterproof seal, the wallpaper extended onto the countertop to cover up the absence of any waterproof seal. Finally, although the separate shower was a nice touch, the tiling in the shower was a little uneven. Again, these are small details, but in a top tier hotel, it's the details that count. I think overall, I would rate this hotel a 3.5. Had it not been for the details, I would have definitely said a 4, or possibly a 4.25. But due to the lack of attention to details, I would overall rate this as a 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: mas709
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and simple: the best hotel stay I have ever had - anywhere. First class treatment all the way, with a chauffeur driven, black BMW 750 or Mercedes-Benz S430 sedan (house car) to and from the office everyday and very courteous treatment by all staff. I was here on business for 5 nights and it was a great place to call home. Probably the only hotel that I was not looking forward to checking out of. The concierge service was friendly, professional and very knowledgeable about the area, including Beverly Hills, Hollywood and the beaches. I could not more highly recommend a hotel to stay in, if you are in Century City. I would advise anyone and everyone against staying at the Crowne Plaza (see my review of this on TripAdvisor as well) - an absolute disaster that cannot even carry the InterContinental's lunch pail.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wannabetrvlr
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline for $90. Was a bit aprehensive. But everythign went smoothly. I belive a very a posh property. Got upgraded to corner room (read bigger with very big balcony). They gave me $35 for dinner couldnt use it. Went down for breakfast has $36 breakfast ( eggs, 2 glasses of juice, one coffee) all chargebale (they didnt tell me the juisce was chargable, but then it was the intercontinental). Chauffered Merc Limo, cannot complain there. Clients very impressed (cant complain with that). The only hting that i saw missing were in hose slippers (but I guess comming from asia I was used to having them mainly because of the ratings). Would have been perfect with an LCD. Visited the bevely hilton which was more impressive, however they are not bookable thorugh priceline ...so for a 100$ this gets all my votes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xreenberg
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the intercontinental. The newer rooms with the flat screen tvs are excellent. The free car service to local destinations is very useful, and staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredorules
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay somewhere close to the Paley Center for Media and that was of reasonable cost - I booked this hotel thru Priceline for about $125 per night - not bad considering. In spite of a previous review about poor service for a Priceline customer, I experienced none of that. All of the staff, front desk, bell, valet, housekeeping were pleasant and helpful. The valet charge was $30 daily and there is no self-park. It does allow in/out as much as you want, though, and the service was always within minutes (word of advice: phone down just before you leave the room and your car will be waiting for you by the time you step outside). The pool area is virtually empty with plenty of lounges. The fitness center is a cut above the usual hotel fitness center,s which can be little more than a few machines in a former room. They must have had at least 15 machines, plus a cold pitcher of water with lemons. Did not eat there nor use the spa. The location was a less than 10 minute drive from downtown Beverly Hills and about ten minutes from Westwood Village. Probably 3 minutes or less to the Westfield mall. All in all, an enjoyable stay and an atomosphere more suited for the business traveler or travelers without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sc4eva
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this new Intercontinental Century City for two nights during a business trip and found it to be of a very high standard with many nice touches. Location: Century City which is a pretty good central location in L.A. to stay. There are a number of great neighborhoods (Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, etc.) and freeways within a 10 min driving distance. The only shopping or restaurants in walk able distance would be the Century City mall but who really walks in a city made for driving. Facilities/Amenities: Gym - Modern and well equipped. Pool - Great place to relax with although the breezes can sometimes bring a chill. No free internet in rooms but free Wi-Fi in the hotel lobby which I was somewhat disappointed about. LAN internet $9.95 a day. Restaurants: Ate the Grill Room for both breakfast and lunch during the course of our stay.
