While expensive the lunch was amazing (Suggest getting the Ahi Tuna and Panna Cotta) Room: Stayed in a LARGE king bed room with separate sitting room complete with an additional T.V., desk and armchairs. The windows were floor to ceiling in each room that open on to a nice size balcony that facing west and the coast. (Would recommend requesting a room facing the back of the hotel as the front is dark half way through the day. Parking: I believe $35 a day (Ouch!) Overall great hotel - Would say it is more geared towards business travelers or guests who are less concerned over some of high costs.

Reviews.Title: “The Intercontinent-Hell”
Reviews.Author: cupcake711
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for 2 nights during our month-long road trip. in all my traveling days, i have never received such poor customer service. oh, where shall i begin? i guess at the beginning. we secured this room through priceline--i'm not sure if the hotel 'blackballs' priceliners, but it certainly seemed the case. we checked in and were given a room on the 5th floor, front left corner. it was a really nice room until we tried to go to bed. we had a great room service 'late night snack' and were just heading to bed until the neighbors started winding up. from 11pm until i called downstairs at 1:15am the guests next door were having a rowdy party--complete with SHOUTING. now, i'm no stranger to neighbors and people living around me, but this was insane. in the morning we asked the front desk if the neighbors would be staying for another night...they were. i asked if we could move rooms. the hotel said it wouldn't be a problem. they would move our bags for us while we were out. we had ordered room service breakfast--what a rip--$20 for a carafe of coffee and ONE (1) slice of toast--in the menu they described a FEAST. i called room service to see what was flying but the woman said there was a TYPO (can you believe this?) on the menu and that the breakfast is only a slice of toast. my husband and i left with the assurance that our bags would be moved to our new room--we got new keys and everything. we departed for the day and returned at 10:30pm to find NO BAGS in our new room. i called downstairs and they showed up 40 minutes later with the bags. i also mentioned that we did not receive our morning wake up call--they had no record of it. i also asked the manager about comping us a breakfast because of the problem we had with the single piece of toast. he shunted me to the room service manager who kept me on hold for ELEVEN (11) minutes--oh, but i WAS NOT hanging up. now it was a battle of wills. finally she took my call and said they would send up complimentary milk and cookies and soda. this was at 10:50pm. by 11:45pm we shut the lights and went to bed. they were obviously NEVER sending anything. i also called for a wake up call and they said no problem. surprise surprise--no wake up call in the morning. i was livid. i called downstairs again--now i was angry about the milk & cookies and the lack of wake up calls TWO mornings in row. i felt like i was trapped in a french farce....it was hellish. after the manager implied that he thought i was LYING about everything...he agreed to send up breakfast. 45 minutes later, we were packed up and leaving. as we opened the door to go, a bellman thrust a newspaper and an envelope containing a 'coupon' for breakfast. we couldn't be bothered...so we just left. my husband and i are friendly, reasonable people. we would have been very happy if they would have sent up a complimentary carafe of coffee and some pastries. instead, they rachected up poor service to new heights and made us miserable--all while insinuating the mistakes were on our part. the rooms were clean but the service was so shoddy that if i had to stay there again i would rather just pay the $37/day charge for valet and SLEEP IN MY CAR. after a month on the road, staying at beautiful hotels across the country, my husband and i still think back on this place with a shudder. if the hotel doesn't want guests from priceline, why accept the bids? the entire staff should take the 'frostiness' down a notch and work on customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Felix-7
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING IS PERFECT. WOULD STAY AGAIN... Two things I did not like: a) could not 2 beds and had to pay $25 per night for roll away. b) parking is steep at $35 a night. But I loved the service, location, condition and great rate I got.

Reviews.Title: “Just a quick overnight...2 would have been better”
Reviews.Author: ktrmeadow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night at the InterContinental, September 14th, 2007. He was taking a pilot review test at the Santa Monica Airport. This location was very close and lovely. We arrived late at about 10pm...and had to depart the next am...so I was not able to truly enjoy this hotel. We had a very low TA rate...and I think that is why we were giving a room on the 5th floor in the back, right over the entire A/C blowers & HVAC system. It was so loud, you really could not sit outside on the balcony. The bell desk and valet service was fantastic. The gym was very up to date with the newest electronic treadmills. The pool was quite and refreshing. The Spa Menu was appealing and offered many selections. I did have a Latte' while waiting for my husband, and in the lobby bar it was $7.50. I don't know if that is normal for LA, but it seemed pricey. Overall, this is a lovely hotel that offers complimentary Mercedes Benz Car Service within one mile of the property. I would recommended this hotel in the future. Ktr....

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: schmossty
Reviews.Content: I was another Priceline occupant at the Intercontinental. The hotel is very cool looking from the outside. The rooms were better than average but could stand for a renovation in a year or so. The gym was nice and FREE which for me is a huge plus! The restaurant was amazing! The food totally yummy but came with a hefty price. Luckily I got a coupon from the front desk ($21.50 off the entree). I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DUCKDUCKG00SE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over $300 a night if you purchased it through the hotel website, but is available on Priceline for much less, and worth every cent. The room and bathroom were fabulous, as was the lobby, location, view from my room and hotel staff. The only possible complaint I would have is the valet-only parking at $30 a night. But for the convenience, cleanliness, and quality of this hotel, it was well worth it. You are very close to Beverly Hills, The Sunset Strip and Hollywood. It's just a couple of miles from the 405 freeway.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like QUEENS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Missy1985
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in L.A and also my first trip away with just "the girls" I didnt know what to expect about the hotel, because as you drive through L.A, some areas can look pretty overwhelming. However, as soon as we go there, it was like a dream come true. All four of us couldn't have asked for more! The servie there was excellent. We honestly felt like stars! We ate in the restaurant there once only because the food can be a little pricey, but it was really good. Honestly, I could say alot of good stuff about this hotel...but i think i would write for hours. All i can say is that if i ever go back to L.A i will return to this hotel. Great price, great service, and just great people over all! The only one thing that wasn;t so great was the fact that it is a little ways away from all the areas that, as a tourist, you want to go see. I suggest to rent a car for the majority of your stay if you do stay here. However, you do a complimentary mercedes (with a driver, theres two and one of the guys is the funniest! his name is junior, he is a great guy) and they will take anywhere within a certain distance though, for example Rodeo drive). Overall GREAT hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Priceline Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: CSwan
Reviews.Content: I travel. Alot. Mostly for business, but my wife and I mix in our fair share of fun traveling. If I'm traveling for business, I tend to stay at Marriott properties because the company is paying and I like the Marriott Rewards program. When it's personal, we like to roll the dice with Priceline to get a nice hotel room at a great price. Priceline has yet to let us down, and this includes the Intercontinental Century City. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive, our room was a decent size 300 to 400 sq ft., and the bed comfortable. Sure, the tv could have been a flat screen, and the bathroom amenities could have been high end, but they weren't and for $90/night on Priceline (rack was 3x's that) who's complaining. Besides, I'm in that room to sleep, not watch tv or sit in a tub. The hotel's location is another one of its attributes. It's a short drive to Santa Monica, Beverly Hills and Hollywood. Also, if you happen to get a room on the back side, your neighbor is the Fox Studios, so you could get the extra bonus of seeing, Brad, Angelina, Scarlett or George. If I had to give it failing marks in one area, it would be the parking situation. There is NO garage for self parking, and you can't park your car along Avenue of the Stars, because there isn't any. They've got a monoply on parking, and they make no apologies for sticking you with a $30/night rate. All in all, it's a nice hotel. What makes it even better is that you can probably get it on Priceline for a fraction of the normal rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved the Intercontinental!”
Reviews.Author: travelnow
Reviews.Content: Very good/excellent hotel. I got this hotel on priceline for $100 a night for a weekend stay. Which for the quality of the hotel and being in Los Angeles, you can't beat the value. I did a lot of research trying to find the right hotel for the right price. I was a little disappointed when I got this hotel on priceline due to the location, but I quickly changed my mind upon arrival. The staff is top notch. The rooms are great. Coffee downstairs in the morning. Sunday morning paper at my door. Car service to the surrounding area. Fox studios right next door. We were given a king on the 14th floor. Great room. Large bathroom. Comfortable king size bed. It had two floor to ceiling windows with a walk out patio!!! The patio was the size of the motel 6 room we stayed up the coast in. Seriously, two lounge chairs, table, and two sun chairs, on the large patio overlooking Beverly Hills, Downtown, Hollywood, and all the surrounding hills. You could see the Hollywood sign from our balcony on a clear morning. Very quiet up that high too. We stayed in room 1411. I would highly suggest room 1411, or maybe just a little better than that, room 1407. Only drawbacks. $30 valet only hotel parking. Was 30% of my room rate. But, very convenient and fast. And to a lesser extent. Location. There is nothing immediately around the hotel. No neighborhood. Beverly Hills is just a few streets away by car, but nothing you really want to walk to. But, if this hotel were right in the middle of one of the trendy neighborhoods, you wouldn't be getting it for $100 a night on priceline either. I would stay here again for sure. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service NOT included”
Reviews.Author: mntcple
Reviews.Content: valet crashed my car, need i say more? and the only thing managment did to make up for it was give my fiance and i each a 30 dollar gift cert for the restaurant on site and take 50 off our entire stay of there, we stayed two nights and first off, the reservations were suppose to be for Aug 24 but were not so we had to pay full price for a small suite. I work for a resort where the suites are 100 percent nicer(clean, huge jaquzzi tub, two fire places, full bar, just beautiful all around) for half the price of Intercontinental. It was my fiances birthday and this hotel ruined it entirely. We have to replace the entire front bumper and our window is broken, something about the crash made it so our window wont even go up. And the Other car that they had crashed into had much worse damage than ours because we have a big SUV. Not only this but the same guy who crashed our car drove our car the same three days we were there, when we asked for someone else they shrugged and said "okay" but didnt change a damn thing. The valet driver didnt even speak english and everytime we tried to explained to him NOT to roll down our window he did anyway, they even posted a note on the door! IT WAS THE MOST HORRIBLE STAY I have ever had anywhere! Nothing about this hotel should make it four stars, except maybe how clean it was but everything else was so average. We WILL never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great LA stay”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: This was our first Hotwire experience and what an amazing hotel for the price! The Intercontinental took over this hotel at the first of the year as it had previously been the Park Hyatt and JW Marriott. It is a lovely property in the heart of Century City. It is more of a business hotel due to its location, however, the hotel has a complimentary car service that will take you to the CC Shopping Center and nearby Rodeo Drive. The concierge staff is so knowledgeable and offered many suggestions. The pool area was well maintained with continual attention by the housekeeping staff. The rooms are comfortable with a great view of the city and the Hollywood hills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a girlfriend for a shopping weekend. Hotel was very nice--not really "hip" but a nice decent place to stay. Booked at a great rate, so I was happy. Bell staff is GREAT. Front desk staff is SNOBBY. Waitied over an hour ++ for late night room service. Housekeeping "forgot" to clean room both days. Had to call 4x for fresh towels. Room service food not very good and VERY expensive. Room had a nice view and great patio. Was double charged each night for valet parking. Was over charged on mini bar but they claim there was nothing i could do as the "bill" was closed and I had to call acctg (huh?). If they needed the extra $$ that bad..... It was "ok." I would stay here again if I got a great rate but would never pay more than $200.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location for tourist!”
Reviews.Author: smes1102
Reviews.Content: As a tourist, the location of this hotel was horrible. Nothing is within walking distance (restaurants, tourist stuff, etc) so if you don't have a car, you'll have to take a cab everywhere. The hotel restaurant was very nice, but for the price of it -- get out and eat somewhere trendy on Sunset Blvd. The room and bathroom were both very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sega10028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Century City for 2 weekend nights in June 2007. I got the room via Priceline for around $110/night, so it was well worth that amount. My only complaint was that my room was very far from the elevator (the hallways take many turns and as a single female traveler I felt a little uncomfortable), and when I asked to move my room the front desk said the hotel was fully booked (this is a large hotel and it did not appear to be crowded my entire stay). I had a room on the 7th floor with a view of the movie sets off the back. The hotel room itself was above average, with a robe, nice toiletries, mini bar, and 2 free bottles of Evian daily. The location is near a great mall, but not much else in my opinion if you're a tourist (it's not near the beach, which is where I spent most of my time). I'm a little more familiar with LA now and when I went back I stayed in Santa Monica, albeit in a room almost 3 times the price of this one. All in all, I recommend this hotel, especially if you can get it on Priceline for around $100.

Reviews.Title: “Boring Location. Super Excellent Chocolate Shakes.”
Reviews.Author: LB1488
Reviews.Content: Went to LA for a little romantic getaway, however, I am young(ish) and poor so I suffered the whims of Priceline and came up with the Intercontinental. Neither a jackpot nor a disappointment (particularly when you're not paying anywhere near rack rate). The Pros? Very clean, *huge* bathrooms (separate tub and shower), lovely beds, friendly room service, and excellent facilities (we made great use of both the pool and the gym). The Cons? The location - downtown LA is good in that it's central, but there is *nothing* worthwhile nearby and as you'd expect, takes *forever* to drive anywhere in LA. This spot would be better fit for business travelers than tourists really. Valet parking - you can not park your own car. Annoying. Room service - while it definitely was a super chocolate milkshake - the room service menu is off-the-charts price-wise (and this is coming from a New Yorker, I'm used to big bills). Plus even though a tip is calculated into your bill, the wait staff clearly expects to be tipped in addition to that amount. Sigh. My final entertaining story: we got in late, checked in and wearily headed to our room. Only to open the door and find... someone asleep, who we clearly scared the [--] out of. Had I been a savvier traveler I would have brokered that into an upgrade. However, I was too tired - so I just trudged back down to the lobby to ask for another room. Which was quickly supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Terrible Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: zeka
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed just one night at the intercontinental. we each had a laptop computer. They info on the desk says that they charge $10 for "1 day" of internet use, which most hotels do nowadays so we paid ten bucks - using my boyfriend's laptop - for the one night we were staying here. At 11pm I attempted to get online using MY laptop instead and was prompted to pay again. Assuming this was a technical glitch I called the front desk -- and was informed by a rude and contrite young man - who said he was the manager - that the service the hotel used charged for each IP address... so if you used a different computer you would be charged ANOTHER ten dollars for the SAME 24 hrs of internet access. When I explained that clearly this was a technical glitch- i was informed that there was nothing to be done about it. If you use more than one computer in your room, you will pay $10 for EACH computer. Ridiculous. Never in my life has a purported four star hotel made that kind of "too bad for you" statement. Poor poor service. Extremely rude and disrespectful. And false advertising to boot. stay away.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Los Angeles Century City
HotelInfo.Address: 2151 Avenue of the Stars, Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
